name: Ab Rollout (Kneeling)
description: Use an ab wheel from your knees to roll forward and back, keeping your core tight and controlling the movement.
instructions: 1. Kneel on the floor with an ab wheel, 2. Roll the wheel forward, extending your body, 3. Engage core to return, 4. Repeat.

name: Ab Rollout (Standing)
description: From a standing position, use an ab wheel to roll forward and back, engaging your core and maintaining control throughout the movement.
instructions: 1. Stand holding an ab wheel with feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Roll the wheel forward, bending at the hips and extending your body, 3. Engage core to return, 4. Repeat.

name: Band Lat Pulldown (Single Arm)
description: Uses resistance bands to strengthen the lats, with core and shoulder stabilizers supporting.
instructions: 1. Anchor a resistance band overhead, 2. Kneel or sit and grab the band with one hand, 3. Pull it down toward your side, 4. Control the return, 5. Switch sides.

name: Band Muscle Up
description: Aided version of the explosive pull-up-to-dip transition that strengthens the lats, chest, and triceps.
instructions: 1. Attach resistance bands to a pull-up bar and grip the bar with an overhand grip, 2. Pull yourself up explosively engaging your upper body and core, 3. Transition your chest over the bar by rotating your wrists, 4. Push down on the bar to complete the dip portion, 5. Lower back down slowly.

name: Barbell Bicep Curl
description: Use a barbell to perform bicep curls, focusing on isolating the biceps while maintaining good form.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold the barbell with palms facing forward, 3. Curl the barbell toward your chest, 4. Slowly lower the barbell back to starting position.

name: Barbell Preacher Curl
description: Barbell curls performed on a preacher bench to isolate and target the biceps.
instructions: 1. Sit on the preacher curl bench, positioning your upper arms on the pad, 2. Grab a barbell with an underhand grip, 3. Curl the barbell toward your shoulders, 4. Lower it back down slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Calf Rasie
description: Use a barbell to perform calf raises, adding weight to build calf strength and size.
instructions: 1. Stand with a barbell across your upper back, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, standing on the balls of your feet, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Calf Rasie (Single Leg)
description: Single-leg calf raises with a barbell, focusing on each calf muscle independently.
instructions: 1. Stand with a barbell across your upper back, 2. Raise one heel off the ground, standing on the ball of that foot, 3. Lower your heel back down slowly, 4. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Barbell Bench Press
description: A compound exercise for the chest, shoulders, and triceps using a barbell on a flat bench.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with your feet on the ground, 2. Grab the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, 3. Lower the barbell to your chest, 4. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Bench Press (Incline)
description: An incline variation of the bench press to target the upper chest and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Set the bench to an incline position, 2. Lie back on the bench with your feet on the ground, 3. Grab the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, 4. Lower the barbell to your upper chest, 5. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Barbell Bench Press (Decline)
description: A decline bench press that focuses on the lower portion of the chest and triceps.
instructions: 1. Set the bench to a decline position, 2. Lie back on the bench with your feet secured, 3. Grab the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, 4. Lower the barbell to your lower chest, 5. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Barbell Floor Press
description: Barbell press on the floor, isolating the chest and triceps while limiting shoulder involvement.
instructions: 1. Lie on the floor with a barbell at chest height, 2. Grab the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, 3. Lower the barbell to your chest, 4. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Wrist Curl
description: Barbell wrist curl for forearm development, focusing on flexion and wrist strength.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your thighs and palms facing up, 2. Grip the barbell with both hands, 3. Curl your wrists upwards, 4. Slowly lower the barbell back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
description: Reverse wrist curls using a barbell to enhance forearm extensor strength and wrist stability.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your thighs and palms facing down, 2. Grip the barbell with both hands, 3. Curl your wrists upwards, 4. Slowly lower the barbell back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
description: Barbell hip thrust to target the glutes and hamstrings by driving the hips upward from a seated position.
instructions: 1. Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench, 2. Roll the barbell over your hips, 3. Drive through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling, 4. Lower your hips back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust (Single Leg)
description: A single-leg variation of the barbell hip thrust to emphasize unilateral glute and hamstring activation.
instructions: 1. Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench, 2. Roll the barbell over your hips, 3. Lift one leg off the ground and drive through the other heel to lift your hips, 4. Lower your hips back down, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Barbell RDL
description: Romanian deadlifts using a barbell to target the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back with a hip-hinge movement.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a barbell in front of you, 2. Hinge at your hips and lower the barbell down while keeping your back straight, 3. Drive your hips forward to return to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Good Morning
description: A hip hinge movement with a barbell on the back to strengthen the lower back, glutes, and hamstrings.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell on your shoulders, 2. Keep your knees slightly bent and hinge at your hips, 3. Lower your torso toward the ground while keeping your back straight, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Deadlift
description: Deadlift using a barbell to target the glutes, hamstrings, lower back, and traps with a powerful lift.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and the barbell over your midfoot, 2. Grip the barbell with both hands, 3. Lift the barbell by driving through your heels, 4. Lower the barbell back to the ground, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Squat
description: Barbell squats to target the quads, hamstrings, and glutes with a deep knee bend.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell on your upper back, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees, 4. Drive through your heels to stand back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Lunge
description: Lunges with a barbell across the back to strengthen the legs, glutes, and core while improving balance.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell on your upper back, 2. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90 degrees, 3. Push back to the starting position, 4. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Bulgarian split squats with a barbell to target the quads, glutes, and improve balance.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell on your upper back, 2. Position one leg behind you on a bench, 3. Lower your body by bending your front knee, 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Barbell Squat (Sumo)
description: Wide stance barbell squats focusing on the inner thighs, glutes, and quads.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed outward, 2. Grip the barbell with both hands between your legs, 3. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees, 4. Push through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Step Up
description: Step-ups with a barbell across the back to target the quads, hamstrings, and glutes.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell on your upper back, 2. Step up onto a bench or platform with one leg, 3. Drive through your heel to bring the other leg up, 4. Step down with the same leg, 5. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Barbell Split Squat
description: Split squats with a barbell placed across the back to target quads, glutes, and hamstrings while improving balance and strength in each leg.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell on your upper back, 2. Position one leg behind you, 3. Lower your body by bending your front knee, 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position

name: Barbell Front Squat
description: Front-loaded barbell squats to emphasize the quads and core by holding the barbell in front of the body.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell across your front deltoids, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees, 4. Drive through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Shoulder Press
description: Overhead pressing with a barbell building shoulders and triceps.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold the barbell at shoulder height with your palms facing forward, 3. Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, 4. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Shoulder Press (Seated)
description: Seated version of the barbell shoulder press for strict control.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with back support, 2. Hold the barbell at shoulder height with your palms facing forward, 3. Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, 4. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Shrug
description: Shrugging shoulders up using a barbell to strengthen the traps.
instructions: 1. Hold a barbell with both hands in front of you, 2. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, 3. Lower your shoulders back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Skullcrusher
description: Barbell tricep exercise lowering weight toward forehead and pressing up.
instructions: 1. Lie on a bench with a barbell in each hand, palms facing each other, 2. Lower the barbell to your forehead by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Bent Over Row
description: Bend at the hips and pull a barbell toward your lower chest for back strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold the barbell with both hands, 2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips, keeping your back straight, 3. Row the barbell towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Inverted Row
description: Hang under a barbell and pull your chest up toward it for back strength.
instructions: 1. Set a barbell in a rack at waist height, 2. Lie underneath the bar and grab it with an overhand grip, 3. Hang with your arms fully extended, keeping your body in a straight line, 4. Pull your chest toward the bar, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 5. Slowly lower yourself back down, 6. Repeat.

name: Barbell Bent Over Row (Reverse-Grip)
description: A barbell row using an underhand grip to work the back and biceps.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the barbell with an underhand grip, 2. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight, 3. Row the barbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Squat (Overhead)
description: A squat movement with a barbell held overhead to build total-body strength and stability.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell across your upper back, 2. Press the barbell overhead, 3. Squat down while keeping the barbell overhead, 4. Push through your heels to stand back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch
description: A single, quick lift moving a barbell from the ground to overhead in one motion.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Grab the barbell with a wide grip, 3. Clean the barbell to your chest, 4. In one explosive motion, lift the barbell overhead, 5. Lower the barbell back down with control, 6. Repeat.

name: Clean and Jerk
description: A two-part lift where the barbell is moved to the shoulders, then pressed overhead.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Grab the barbell with a wide grip, 3. Clean the barbell to your chest, 4. Jerk the barbell overhead, 5. Lower the barbell with control, 6. Repeat.

name: Power Snatch
description: A snatch done without dropping into a deep squat, focusing on speed and power.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Grab the barbell with a wide grip, 3. Clean the barbell to your chest, 4. In one explosive motion, lift the barbell overhead without a full squat, 5. Lower the barbell back down with control, 6. Repeat.

name: Hang Snatch
description: A snatch variation starting from a standing position with the bar at the thighs.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold the barbell at hip height, 3. Clean the barbell to your chest, 4. In one explosive motion, lift the barbell overhead from the hang position, 5. Lower the barbell back down with control, 6. Repeat.

name: Hang Power Snatch
description: A fast, high catch version of the hang snatch without deep squatting.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold the barbell at hip height, 3. Clean the barbell to your chest, 4. In one explosive motion, lift the barbell overhead without a full squat, 5. Lower the barbell back down with control, 6. Repeat.

name: Block Snatch
description: A snatch performed with the bar starting on raised blocks instead of the floor.
instructions: 1. Set the barbell on blocks just above the knees, 2. Perform a snatch by pulling the barbell overhead in one explosive motion, 3. Ensure you lock out your arms and stand tall, 4. Lower the barbell back down with control, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch from Deficit
description: A snatch where you start standing on a platform to increase range and pulling strength.
instructions: 1. Stand on a platform to increase the range of motion, 2. Grab the barbell with a wide grip, 3. Perform the snatch from the lower position, ensuring good form, 4. Pull the barbell overhead with explosive force, 5. Lower the barbell back down with control, 6. Repeat.

name: Tall Snatch
description: A technique drill focusing on quickly moving the bar overhead from a tall standing position.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with the barbell at the hips, 2. Perform a snatch by explosively pulling the barbell overhead, 3. Ensure you maintain a vertical path and lock out your arms at the top, 4. Return the barbell to the ground with control, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch (Pause)
description: A snatch variation with deliberate pauses during the pull to improve strength and control.
instructions: 1. Perform a snatch but pause for a brief moment at the knee or mid-thigh position before continuing the lift, 2. Continue pulling the barbell overhead, 3. Ensure you maintain proper form throughout the pause, 4. Return the barbell to the ground, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch (Pull)
description: Practicing just the pulling part of the snatch without lifting the bar overhead.
instructions: 1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Start the pull from the floor by extending your hips and knees, 3. Focus on driving the barbell up without pulling it too early, 4. Lower the barbell back to the ground, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch (High Pull)
description: A pull movement lifting the bar explosively to chest height without going overhead.
instructions: 1. Perform the snatch pull by extending your legs and hips explosively while pulling the barbell to chest height, 2. Squeeze your traps and shoulders at the top, 3. Lower the barbell back down with control, 4. Repeat.

name: Snatch Deadlift
description: A deadlift using a wide snatch grip to build pulling strength for the snatch.
instructions: 1. Start with the barbell on the ground, 2. Perform a deadlift motion to lift the barbell while maintaining a proper hip and back position, 3. Focus on engaging the hamstrings and glutes, 4. Lower the barbell back to the ground with control, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch Grip Push Press
description: Pressing a bar overhead with a wide grip using some help from the legs.
instructions: 1. Set the barbell on your shoulders with a snatch grip, 2. Dip your knees and drive the barbell overhead with a powerful leg extension, 3. Lock out your arms at the top, 4. Lower the barbell back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Power Clean
description: Quickly lifting a bar from the ground to the shoulders without a deep squat.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Grab the barbell with an overhand grip, 3. Pull the barbell explosively from the ground to your shoulders, 4. Drop underneath the bar to catch it in a partial squat, 5. Stand tall with the barbell on your shoulders, 6. Lower the barbell to the ground, 7. Repeat.

name: Hang Clean
description: A clean starting from a standing position with the bar hanging at the thighs.
instructions: 1. Begin with the barbell at thigh height (hang position), 2. Perform the clean by pulling the barbell explosively from the hang to your shoulders, 3. Drop underneath the bar to catch it in a squat, 4. Stand tall and lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Hang Power Clean
description: A fast, high catch version of the hang clean without a full squat.
instructions: 1. Similar to the hang clean, but do not drop into a full squat; catch the barbell in a quarter squat, 2. Stand tall after catching the barbell, 3. Lower the barbell, 4. Repeat.

name: Block Clean
description: A clean movement starting from blocks to shorten the pull distance.
instructions: 1. Set the barbell on blocks just above your knees, 2. Pull the barbell explosively from the blocks to your shoulders, 3. Drop underneath the bar to catch it, 4. Stand tall, 5. Lower the barbell, 6. Repeat.

name: Clean from Deficit
description: A clean starting from an elevated platform to train pulling strength.
instructions: 1. Stand on a platform to increase the range of motion, 2. Perform a clean from the floor, focusing on pulling the barbell explosively to your shoulders, 3. Drop underneath the bar to catch it in a squat, 4. Stand tall, 5. Lower the barbell, 6. Repeat.

name: Clean Pull
description: Practicing just the pull phase of the clean without catching the bar.
instructions: 1. Start with the barbell on the ground, 2. Perform an explosive hip extension to pull the barbell up to chest height, 3. Focus on engaging the hips and traps, 4. Lower the barbell back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Clean High Pull
description: A clean pull with extra height, pulling the bar up toward the chest.
instructions: 1. Similar to the clean pull but focus on pulling the barbell higher (to around chest height), 2. Squeeze your traps at the top, 3. Lower the barbell with control, 4. Repeat.

name: Muscle Clean
description: A clean done slowly without using much leg drive or a catch.
instructions: 1. Start by gripping the barbell at shoulder width, 2. Perform a clean by explosively pulling the barbell up, 3. Use your arms to guide the bar to your shoulders, 4. Catch the bar in a high front squat position, 5. Stand tall, 6. Lower the barbell, 7. Repeat.

name: Pause Clean
description: A clean with a deliberate pause during the pull to build control and strength.
instructions: 1. Perform a clean but pause at a specific point, such as at the knees or mid-thigh, before completing the movement, 2. Perform the rest of the clean, 3. Lower the barbell back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Tall Clean
description: A clean focusing on dropping under the bar from a tall standing position.
instructions: 1. Stand tall and hold the barbell at your hips, 2. Perform the clean by pulling the barbell overhead, 3. Focus on explosive movement, 4. Lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Push Jerk
description: A dip and drive movement pressing a bar overhead, using the legs to help.
instructions: 1. Stand with the barbell on your shoulders, 2. Dip your knees slightly, 3. Explosively drive the barbell overhead, 4. Lock out your arms, 5. Lower the barbell, 6. Repeat.

name: Split Jerk
description: A jerk where the legs split into a lunge position while the bar is locked overhead.
instructions: 1. Stand with the barbell on your shoulders, 2. Dip your knees slightly, 3. Drive the barbell overhead, 4. Split your legs into a lunge position, 5. Lock out your arms, 6. Return to a standing position, 7. Lower the barbell, 8. Repeat.

name: Power Jerk
description: A jerk catching the bar overhead with a shallow knee bend instead of a deep split.
instructions: 1. Stand with the barbell on your shoulders, 2. Dip your knees and explosively drive the barbell overhead, 3. Catch the bar with your legs slightly bent (no full split), 4. Stand tall and lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Jerk with Block
description: Practicing the jerk using blocks to catch the bar after locking it overhead.
instructions: 1. Perform a jerk (split, power, or push) with the barbell resting on blocks, 2. Focus on explosive movement, 3. Catch the bar overhead with locked arms, 4. Lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Jerk from Rack
description: Performing a jerk starting with the bar already positioned on a squat rack.
instructions: 1. Set the barbell on a rack at shoulder height, 2. Perform a jerk (push, split, or power) from this position, 3. Lock out your arms overhead, 4. Lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Tall Jerk
description: A drill focusing on dropping under the bar quickly without a big leg drive.
instructions: 1. Perform a jerk from a standing position, 2. Focus on driving the barbell overhead explosively, 3. Lock out your arms and lower the barbell, 4. Repeat.

name: Pause Jerk
description: A jerk variation with a pause before driving the bar up to improve control.
instructions: 1. Perform a jerk, but pause at the dip position for a brief moment before continuing the movement, 2. Drive the barbell overhead and lock your arms, 3. Lower the barbell, 4. Repeat.

name: Jerk Balance
description: A drill helping you practice stepping and catching during a split jerk.
instructions: 1. Start with the barbell on your shoulders, 2. Dip and drive the barbell overhead, 3. As you catch the bar, move into a lunge position to stabilize the weight, 4. Return to standing, 5. Lower the barbell, 6. Repeat.

name: Jerk Recovery
description: Practicing standing back up from the lunge position after catching a jerk.
instructions: 1. Perform a jerk (split or power), 2. Catch the bar overhead, 3. Recover by bringing your legs together, 4. Lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch Drop
description: A drill practicing quickly dropping under the bar into an overhead squat.
instructions: 1. Hold the barbell overhead, 2. Drop into a squat position with control, 3. Stand back up, 4. Lower the barbell back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Jerk Drop
description: A drill practicing dropping into the split jerk position under a bar without pressing.
instructions: 1. Hold the barbell overhead, 2. Drop under the bar into a split stance with control, 3. Recover, 4. Lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Snatch Extension
description: Finishing the pull of a snatch explosively without actually catching the bar.
instructions: 1. Perform a snatch pull but extend the barbell higher, 2. Focus on engaging the traps and shoulders, 3. Lower the barbell, 4. Repeat.

name: Clean Extension
description: Finishing the pull of a clean with full extension but without catching the bar.
instructions: 1. Similar to the snatch extension but with a clean grip, 2. Pull the barbell higher, 3. Engage your traps and shoulders, 4. Lower the barbell, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Overhead Hold
description: Holding a bar or weight overhead to build shoulder and core stability.
instructions: 1. Hold a barbell overhead with arms fully extended, 2. Maintain a stable core and locked arms, 3. Hold for a set amount of time, 4. Lower the barbell with control.

name: Clean/Snatch Pull to Knee
description: Pulling the bar up to the knees and pausing to train position and strength.
instructions: 1. Perform a clean or snatch pull, but stop when the barbell reaches your knees, 2. Focus on proper extension and posture, 3. Lower the barbell back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Snatch with Slow Pull
description: Performing the first part of the snatch slowly to build control and positioning.
instructions: 1. Perform the snatch but emphasize the initial pull, moving the bar slowly from the ground to knee height, 2. Afterward, perform the rest of the snatch with explosive force, 3. Lower the barbell, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Abs Rollout
description: An advanced core exercise focusing on the rectus abdominis and deep stabilizers through dynamic extension.
instructions: 1. Load a barbell with plates and kneel behind it, 2. Grip the bar and roll it forward, 3. Extend your body while keeping core tight, 4. Roll back to start.

name: Barbell Hack Squat
description: Emphasizes quadriceps development with a rear-loaded squat variation to reduce spinal load.
instructions: 1. Stand with a barbell behind your legs, 2. Grip the bar and lower into a squat, 3. Drive up to standing while keeping bar close, 4. Repeat the motion.

name: Barbell Shouler Press (Incline)
description: Strengthens the anterior deltoids, upper chest, and triceps from a seated incline angle.
instructions: 1. Sit on an incline bench and grip the barbell, 2. Press the bar upward over your head, 3. Lower it slowly to your upper chest, 4. Repeat with control.

name: Barbell Shrug Behind the Back
description: Targets the upper traps and improves posture through vertical scapular elevation.
instructions: 1. Hold a barbell behind your back, 2. Shrug your shoulders upward, 3. Squeeze at the top, 4. Lower slowly.

name: Barbell Walking Lunge
description: Builds unilateral strength and stability in quads, glutes, and hamstrings with added load.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell across your upper back, 2. Step forward into a lunge, 3. Push off and bring the rear leg forward into the next lunge, 4. Continue walking with controlled lunges.

name: Barbell Bench Press (Chains)
description: Builds chest, triceps, and shoulder strength with accommodating resistance to target lockout.
instructions: 1. Load a barbell with chains, 2. Lie on the bench and grip the bar, 3. Lower to your chest and press up, 4. Control each rep.

name: Barbell Bicep Curl (Close Grip)
description: Focuses on the outer head of the biceps brachii to build peak and overall arm muscle.
instructions: 1. Hold a barbell with a close underhand grip, 2. Keep elbows close to your torso, 3. Curl the barbell up by contracting your biceps, 4. Lower it slowly to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Drag Curl
description: Works the biceps brachii with a backward pulling motion to emphasize the peak of the bicep and overall arm development.
instructions: 1. Hold a barbell in front of your thighs, 2. Pull it up along your body by dragging elbows back, 3. Squeeze biceps at the top, 4. Lower slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Good Morning (Off Pins)
description: Strengthens the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back, focusing on hip hinge mechanics and posterior chain development.
instructions: 1. Set a barbell on safety pins at shoulder height, 2. Step under and unrack, 3. Bend at the hips while keeping back straight, 4. Lower torso forward, 5. Return to standing.

name: Barbell Rack Pull
description: Targets the lower back, glutes, and traps, focusing on the lockout phase of a deadlift from an elevated position.
instructions: 1. Stand in front of a barbell set just below the knees for Barbell Rack Pulls, 2. Grip the bar with hands shoulder-width apart, 3. Engage your core and pull the bar up until standing straight, 4. Lower back down to just below the knees, 5. Repeat.

name: Bench Jump
description: A lower-body plyometric exercise targeting glutes, quads, and calves to enhance explosive power.
instructions: 1. Stand in front of a sturdy bench, 2. Jump up with both feet, 3. Land softly on the bench, 4. Step down and repeat.

name: Bodyweight Tricep Press (Bench)
description: Strengthens the triceps and shoulders by lowering the body from an elevated surface.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with hands behind you, 2. Slide forward off the edge, 3. Lower your body by bending elbows, 4. Push back up.

name: Lying Leg Raise
description: Engage the lower abs by lifting legs while lying flat on your back, keeping them straight.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with legs straight, 2. Raise legs to 90 degrees, 3. Lower back to starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Fire Hydrant
description: Activate the glutes and hips by lifting one knee sideways while keeping hands and knees on the ground.
instructions: 1. Start in tabletop position, 2. Bend knee to 90 degrees, 3. Raise leg out to the side while keeping knee bent, 4. Lower and repeat.

name: Bodyweight Lateral Leg Raise
description: Lift one leg sideways while standing to target the hip abductors and glutes without any equipment.
instructions: 1. Stand upright, 2. Shift weight onto one leg, 3. Lift the other leg to the side, 4. Lower and repeat.

name: Sit Up
description: Strengthen the core by lying on your back and lifting your upper body towards your knees.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent, 2. Place hands behind head or on chest, 3. Engage core and lift torso, 4. Lower back and repeat.

name: Crunch
description: Focus on the upper abdominal muscles by curling the torso towards the knees while lying on your back.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent, 2. Place hands behind head or on chest, 3. Lift shoulders off the floor, 4. Lower back down and repeat.

name: Bicycle Crunch
description: Perform a twisting crunch while alternating bringing opposite elbows and knees together in a cycling motion.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with hands behind head, 2. Bring one knee toward chest, 3. Twist torso to bring opposite elbow to knee, 4. Alternate sides.

name: Plank
description: Engage the core and maintain a straight line from head to heels while holding a forearm plank position.
instructions: 1. Start in a forearm plank position, 2. Engage core and keep body in a straight line, 3. Hold for the desired time.

name: V-Up
description: Target the abs by simultaneously lifting your legs and torso to form a V shape while lying down.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with arms overhead and legs straight, 2. Lift legs and torso, reaching hands to toes, 3. Lower back and repeat.

name: Mountain Climber
description: Perform a dynamic core exercise by alternating bringing knees to the chest in a push-up position.
instructions: 1. Start in push-up position, 2. Engage your core and bring one knee toward chest, 3. Switch legs quickly in a running motion, 4. Continue alternating.

name: 6-Inch Hold
description: Strengthen the lower abs by holding your legs six inches above the ground while lying on your back.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with legs straight, 2.  Engage your core and lift legs about 6 inches off the floor, 3. Hold position for the desired time.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
description: Activate the lower abs by hanging from a bar and lifting your legs up to a 90-degree angle.
instructions: 1. Hang from a pull-up bar, 2. Keep legs straight and  engage your core, 3. Raise legs to 90 degrees, 4. Lower back and repeat.

name: Scissor Kick
description: Work the core and hip flexors by alternating leg kicks while lying on your back.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with legs straight, 2. Lift legs slightly off the floor, 3. Alternate crossing legs in a scissor-like motion, 4. Repeat.

name: Dead Bug
description: Lie on your back and alternate extending opposite arm and leg, engaging the core for stability.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with arms extended, knees bent, 2. Lower opposite arm and leg, 3. Return to start and alternate sides.

name: Toe Touch
description: Lie on your back and reach for your toes with your hands while lifting your legs straight up.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with legs extended, 2. Lift legs and reach hands toward toes, 3. Lower back and repeat.

name: Bodyweight Calf Raise
description: Calf raises using body weight to activate and strengthen the calves without extra resistance.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, standing on the balls of your feet, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Calf Raise (Single Leg)
description: Single-leg calf raises using body weight, isolating each calf muscle effectively.
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg, 2. Raise your heel off the ground, standing on the ball of that foot, 3. Lower your heel back down slowly.

name: Push Up
description: Bodyweight chest exercise that also works the shoulders and triceps, engaging the core for stability.
instructions: 1. Get into a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, 2. Lower your body to the ground by bending your elbows, 3. Push your body back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Push Up (Incline)
description: Inclined push-ups focusing on the upper chest and shoulders, increasing range of motion.
instructions: 1. Place your hands on an elevated surface (like a bench or step), 2. Lower your body toward the surface by bending your elbows, 3. Push your body back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Push Up (Decline)
description: Declined push-ups emphasizing the lower chest and increasing triceps involvement.
instructions: 1. Place your feet on an elevated surface (like a bench or step), 2. Lower your body to the ground by bending your elbows, 3. Push your body back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Glute Bridge
description: Lying on your back, lifting the hips off the floor to engage the glutes and hamstrings.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, 2. Drive through your heels to lift your hips off the ground, 3. Squeeze your glutes at the top, 4. Lower your hips back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Nordic Hamstring Curl
description: Eccentric hamstring exercise performed by lowering the body forward and resisting with the hamstrings.
instructions: 1. Kneel on the ground with your feet anchored, 2. Slowly lower your body forward, keeping your hips extended, 3. Use your hamstrings to pull yourself back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Squat
description: Squatting using just body weight, focusing on form, quads, glutes, and core activation.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Lower your body by bending your knees, 3. Keep your chest up and back straight, 4. Drive through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Squat Jump
description: Bodyweight squat jumps to increase leg power and engage the glutes and quads.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Lower into a squat position, 3. Explosively jump upwards, 4. Land softly and immediately lower back into a squat, 5. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Lunge
description: Forward lunges using bodyweight to target the quads, hamstrings, and glutes with controlled movement.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, 2. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90 degrees, 3. Push back to the starting position, 4. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Bodyweight Glute Bridge (Single Leg)
description: A single-leg variation of the glute bridge to target each glute and hamstring individually while enhancing stability.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat on the ground, 2. Lift your other leg off the ground, 3. Drive through your heel to lift your hips, 4. Lower your hips back down, 5. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Wall Sit
description: Sitting against a wall with the knees at a 90-degree angle to build endurance and strength in the quads and glutes.
instructions: 1. Stand with your back against a wall, 2. Slide down into a squat position until your knees are bent at 90 degrees, 3. Hold the position for a set time, 4. Slowly rise back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Back Extension
description: A back extension exercise performed on a bench to target the lower back muscles (erector spinae) and glutes for improved posterior chain strength.
instructions: 1. Position yourself face down on a back extension bench, 2. Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands behind your head, 3. Lower your upper body toward the ground, 4. Raise your body back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Superman
description: A bodyweight exercise where you lie face down and lift both arms and legs off the ground, engaging the back, glutes, and hamstrings.
instructions: 1. Lie face down on the floor with your arms extended in front of you, 2. Lift your arms and legs off the ground simultaneously, 3. Hold at the top for a moment, 4. Lower back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Sissy Squat
description: A deep knee-dominant squat variation where the torso stays upright while the knees travel forward, emphasizing the quadriceps.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, 3. Slowly lower your body by leaning back while keeping your knees extended, 4. Push through your knees to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: Handstand Push Up
description: Upside-down push-ups building strong shoulders and arms.
instructions: 1. Kick into a handstand position against a wall, 2. Lower your body until your head almost touches the ground, 3. Push yourself back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Leg Stance (Single leg)
description: Standing on one leg to train balance and stability.
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg, focusing on balance and stability, 2. Engage your core and maintain your posture, 3. Hold for a set time, 4. Switch legs, 5. Repeat.

name: Leg Stance (Single leg/Eyes Closed)
description: Standing on one leg with eyes closed to challenge balance even more.
instructions: 1. Perform the single-leg stance, but with your eyes closed for added difficulty, 2. Focus on maintaining balance, 3. Hold for a set time, 4. Switch legs, 5. Repeat.

name: Leg Stance (Knee up)
alias_2: Single Leg Hold with Raised Knee
description: Balancing on one leg while keeping the other knee lifted.
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg with your other leg lifted at a 90-degree angle, 2. Focus on balance and stability, 3. Hold for a set time, 4. Switch legs, 5. Repeat.

name: Leg Stance (Knee up/Eyes Closed)
description: Balancing with one knee up and eyes closed to make it harder.
instructions: 1. Perform the knee-up stance while keeping your eyes closed for added difficulty, 2. Focus on balance, 3. Hold for a set time, 4. Switch legs, 5. Repeat.

name: Toe Touch (Single Leg)
description: Balancing on one leg while reaching down to touch the floor.
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg and reach down with the opposite hand to touch your toes, 2. Focus on keeping your hips level and engaging your core, 3. Return to standing, 4. Switch legs, 5. Repeat.

name: Tandem Walk
description: Walking in a straight line heel-to-toe to practice coordination and balance.
instructions: 1. Walk with one foot directly in front of the other, focusing on maintaining balance, 2. Continue walking in a straight line, 3. Repeat.

name: Heel-to-Toe Walk
description: A walking drill placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot.
instructions: 1. Walk by placing the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other, 2. Maintain balance and control, 3. Repeat.

name: Tandem Stance Hold
description: Standing heel-to-toe and holding the position to practice balance.
instructions: 1. Stand in a tandem position (one foot in front of the other), 2. Hold this position for a set amount of time, 3. Switch legs, 4. Repeat.

name: World's Greatest Stretch
description: A full-body stretch focusing on the hips, hamstrings, and thoracic spine.
instructions: 1. Start in a standing position, 2. Step one leg forward into a lunge, 3. Lower your hips to the floor, 4. Reach one arm overhead and twist your torso toward the bent leg, 5. Hold the stretch, 6. Repeat on the other side.

name: Cat-Cow
description: A gentle spinal movement moving between arching and rounding the back.
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position with hands under shoulders and knees under hips, 2. Inhale and drop your belly toward the floor, lifting your chest and tailbone (Cow), 3. Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin to your chest (Cat), 4. Repeat for several breaths.

name: Inchworm to Cobra
description: Walking the hands out into a plank, then flowing into a chest-opening stretch.
instructions: 1. Start standing tall, 2. Hinge at your hips and walk your hands forward to a plank position, 3. Lower your body to the floor into a cobra stretch, 4. Press your chest upward, 5. Reverse the movement to walk your hands back to your feet, 6. Stand up.

name: Downward Dog
description: A yoga pose stretching the hamstrings, calves, and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Start on your hands and knees, 2. Lift your hips toward the ceiling, forming an inverted V, 3. Keep your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart, 4. Press your heels toward the floor and hold the position, 5. Breathe deeply.

name: Upward Dog
description: A yoga pose lifting the chest while keeping the hips close to the ground.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on your stomach, 2. Place your hands beside your chest, 3. Push through your hands to lift your chest off the ground and extend your legs, 4. Look slightly upward and hold, 5. Return to the floor.

name: Downward Dog to Upward Dog Flow
description: A dynamic movement flowing between downward and upward dog poses.
instructions: 1. Start in Downward Dog, 2. Flow into Upward Dog by dropping your hips and lifting your chest, 3. Flow back into Downward Dog by lifting your hips toward the ceiling, 4. Repeat the flow.

name: 90/90 Hip Switch
description: Rotating the hips side to side while sitting with bent knees to improve mobility.
instructions: 1. Sit with one leg in front of you and the other bent behind you at 90 degrees, 2. Keep your torso upright, 3. Switch your legs by rotating your hips and placing the opposite leg in front, 4. Repeat back and forth.

name: Neck Circle
description: Slow circular movements of the neck to loosen tightness and improve mobility.
instructions: 1. Sit or stand tall, 2. Slowly move your head in a circular motion, first clockwise, then counterclockwise, 3. Repeat several times in both directions.

name: Shoulder CAR
description: Controlled rotations of the shoulders to maintain joint health and mobility.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with arms extended, 2. Slowly rotate your arms in large circles, 3. Focus on maintaining control and moving through the full range of motion, 4. Repeat in both directions.

name: Wall Slide
description: Sliding arms up and down a wall to improve shoulder flexibility and posture.
instructions: 1. Stand with your back against a wall, 2. Place your arms at 90 degrees and press them against the wall, 3. Slowly slide your arms upward while keeping them in contact with the wall, 4. Lower them back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Scapular Push-Up
description: A push-up variation moving only the shoulder blades to strengthen scapular muscles.
instructions: 1. Start in a plank position, 2. Keep your arms straight, 3. Lower your chest toward the ground by squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Push through your shoulders to raise your body back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Thread the Needle
description: A stretch focusing on the mid-back and shoulders by reaching under the body.
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position, 2. Reach one arm under your body and twist your torso, threading your arm through to the other side, 3. Rest your shoulder and head on the floor, 4. Hold and then return to starting position, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Arm Circle
description: Moving the arms in circles to warm up the shoulders.
instructions: 1. Extend your arms out to the sides, 2. Move your arms in small circles, gradually increasing the size, 3. Continue for several seconds, then reverse the direction.

name: Sleeper Stretch
description: A stretch lying on the side to target the posterior shoulder capsule.
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with your bottom arm extended, 2. Use your top hand to gently press your bottom armâ€™s wrist towards the floor, 3. Hold the stretch and breathe deeply, 4. Repeat on the other side.

name: Wrist CAR
description: Controlled wrist circles to maintain joint health and mobility.
instructions: 1. Extend your arms in front of you, 2. Move your wrists in large circles in both directions, 3. Focus on moving through the full range of motion.

name: Open Book Stretch
description: A thoracic spine stretch rotating the chest open while lying down.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with your arms extended out to the sides, 2. Bring one knee up toward your chest, 3. Rotate your torso and lower leg to the opposite side, 4. Hold the stretch, then return to center, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Kneeling Thoracic Rotation
description: Rotating the upper body while kneeling to improve mid-back mobility.
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position, 2. Place one hand behind your head, 3. Rotate your upper body toward the ceiling, 4. Hold the rotation, then return to starting position, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Quadruped T-Spine Rotation
description: Rotating the chest while on all fours to work on thoracic mobility.
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position, 2. Place one hand behind your head, 3. Rotate your upper body and elbow toward the ceiling, 4. Hold the rotation, then return to starting position, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Hip CAR
description: Controlled hip rotations to keep the hip joint healthy and mobile.
instructions: 1. Stand tall or sit with a neutral spine, 2. Lift one knee and rotate it outward, 3. Move your leg through a full range of motion, 4. Repeat in both directions.

name: Hip Circles (Standing)
description: Drawing circles with the hips while standing to loosen up the hips.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Slowly rotate your hip joint in large circles, 3. Repeat for several seconds, then reverse direction.

name: Hip Circles (Quadruped)
description: Performing hip circles while on all fours for more isolated hip work.
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position, 2. Lift one knee off the floor and rotate your hip in a circular motion, 3. Repeat in both directions.

name: Pigeon Pose
description: A yoga pose opening up the hips and stretching the glutes.
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position, 2. Bring one knee forward and bend it in front of you, 3. Extend your other leg straight behind you, 4. Lower your hips toward the floor and hold the stretch, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Frog Stretch
description: A deep inner thigh and hip stretch done on the ground.
instructions: 1. Start in a tabletop position, 2. Widen your knees and lower your hips toward the ground, 3. Hold the stretch and feel it in your hips, 4. Breathe deeply and hold.

name: Knee CAR
description: Controlled rotations of the knees to maintain mobility and joint health.
instructions: 1. Stand or sit tall, 2. Lift one knee and rotate it in a circular motion, 3. Repeat in both directions.

name: Standing Calf Raises with Hold
description: Rising onto the toes and holding to strengthen the calves.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, 2. Rise up onto your toes and hold the position for a few seconds, 3. Lower back down with control, 4. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Glute Bridge Hold
description: Holding a bridge position to strengthen the glutes and hamstrings.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with your feet flat on the floor and knees bent, 2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees, 3. Hold the position, engaging your glutes and core, 4. Lower your hips back down.

name: Isometric Squat
description: Holding the bottom of a squat to build lower body strength and endurance.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Lower into a squat position, 3. Hold the squat position for a set amount of time, 4. Focus on keeping your knees over your toes.

name: Split Squat Hold
description: Holding a split squat position to work on single-leg strength and stability.
instructions: 1. Get into a split squat position with one leg forward, 2. Lower your body so both knees are at 90 degrees, 3. Hold the position for a set amount of time, 4. Repeat on the other side.

name: Calf Raise Hold
description: Holding the calves contracted at the top of a calf raise.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, 2. Rise up onto your toes and hold the position, 3. Engage your calves, 4. Lower back down with control.

name: Jumping Jack
description: A cardio exercise involving jumping with arms and legs moving out and in.
instructions: 1. Start with feet together and arms by your sides, 2. Jump your feet out while raising your arms overhead, 3. Jump back to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: High Knee
description: Running in place with knees lifted high to work on cardio and hip flexor strength.
instructions: 1. Stand tall and jog in place, lifting your knees as high as possible toward your chest, 2. Keep a fast pace and engage your core.

name: Butt Kick
description: Running in place while kicking the heels up toward the glutes.
instructions: 1. Jog in place while kicking your heels up toward your glutes, 2. Keep your pace steady and your core engaged.

name: Burpee
description: A full-body movement combining a squat, jump, and push-up.
instructions: 1. Stand tall, 2. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the floor, 3. Jump your feet back into a plank, 4. Perform a push-up, 5. Jump your feet forward, then explosively jump into the air, 6. Repeat.

name: Frog Jump
description: Explosive squat jumps mimicking a frogâ€™s leap to build power.
instructions: 1. Start in a deep squat position, 2. Explosively jump forward while keeping your feet wide, 3. Land softly and immediately jump again, 4. Repeat.

name: Lateral Bound
description: Jumping side to side to develop lateral strength and power.
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg and jump sideways to land on the other leg, 2. Immediately jump back in the opposite direction, 3. Repeat for several bounds.

name: Sitting Groin Stretch
description: Enhances flexibility in the inner thighs and adductors by opening the hips in a seated position.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor and bring the soles of your feet together, 2. Let your knees drop to the sides, 3. Hold your feet with your hands, 4. Lean forward slightly for a deeper stretch.

name: All Fours Quad Stretch
description: Stretches the quadriceps and hip flexors while maintaining spinal neutrality from a quadruped position.
instructions: 1. Start on all fours, 2. Reach one hand back to grab the foot of the same-side leg, 3. Gently pull the foot toward your glutes, 4. Hold the stretch and switch sides.

name: Alternate Heel Toucher
description: Engages the obliques and rectus abdominis to promote lateral core strength and stability.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, 2. Crunch to one side to touch your heel with your hand, 3. Return to center and crunch to the other side, 4. Alternate sides continuously.

name: Diagonal Bound
description: A plyometric movement focusing on glutes, hamstrings, and lateral agility for explosive power.
instructions: 1. Stand on one foot and jump diagonally forward to land on the opposite foot, 2. Land softly and immediately bound to the other side, 3. Keep bounding side to side at a steady rhythm.

name: Ankle Circle
description: Improves ankle joint mobility and stability, aiding in injury prevention and warm-up.
instructions: 1. Sit or lie down and extend one leg, 2. Rotate your ankle in a circular motion clockwise, 3. After several rotations, switch to counterclockwise, 4. Repeat with the other ankle.

name: Behind Head Chest Stretch
description: Opens the chest and shoulders to improve posture and flexibility in the pectoral muscles.
instructions: 1. Stand tall and place hands behind your head, 2. Pull elbows back to open the chest, 3. Hold the stretch, 4. Breathe deeply.

name: Wall Calf Stretch
description: Stretches the calf and soleus muscles to improve ankle flexibility and reduce tightness.
instructions: 1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on it, 2. Step one foot back and press heel down, 3. Lean forward slightly, 4. Hold and switch sides.

name: Hamstring Stretch (Seated)
description: Lengthens the hamstring muscles to increase flexibility and range of motion in the back of the legs.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you, 2. Hinge at the hips and reach your hands toward your toes, 3. Keep your back flat and hold the stretch, 4. Breathe deeply and hold for 20-30 seconds, 5. Release and repeat.

name: Chair Squat
description: Engages the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings to build lower body strength and improve functional movement with reduced joint stress.
instructions: 1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width apart, 2. Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees as if sitting, 3. Lightly touch the chair with your glutes, 4. Push through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat the movement.

name: Child's Pose
description: Gently stretches the hips, thighs, and back while promoting relaxation and reducing stress.
instructions: 1. Kneel on the floor and sit back on your heels, 2. Lower your torso forward, reaching your arms out in front, 3. Rest your forehead on the floor, 4. Breathe deeply and relax your body, 5. Hold the position.

name: Donkey Calf Raise
description: Emphasizes the calf muscle in the calves through a bent-over position to maximize muscle isolation and growth.
instructions: 1. Bend forward and support your upper body on a bench or partner, 2. Let your heels hang off a raised surface, 3. Raise heels by contracting calves, 4. Lower slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: Runner's Lunge
description: Stretches the hip flexors and quadriceps while improving hip mobility and balance.
instructions: 1. Step one foot forward into a deep lunge, 2. Place both hands on the floor inside your front foot, 3. Keep back leg extended, 4. Hold the stretch, 5. Switch sides.

name: Jacknife Sit Up
description: Works the upper and lower abdominal muscles and hip flexors to build core strength and stability.
instructions: 1. Lie flat with arms extended overhead, 2. Simultaneously lift arms and legs, 3. Touch your toes at the top, 4. Lower under control, 5. Repeat.

name: Push Ups (Knees)
description: Targets the chest (pectorals), shoulders (anterior deltoids), and triceps to build upper body pushing strength with a modified difficulty.
instructions: 1. Start in plank with knees on the ground, 2. Lower chest to the floor, 3. Push back up, 4. Keep body straight, 5. Repeat.

name: Peroneals Stretch
description: Aims to lengthen the peroneal muscles along the outer lower leg to aid ankle mobility and prevent strains.
instructions: 1. Sit with one leg crossed over the other, 2. Pull your foot inward to stretch the outer ankle, 3. Hold for 20-30 seconds, 4. Release, 5. Switch sides.

name: Push Up to Side Plank
description: Combines chest and triceps pressing with oblique and glute engagement in the side plank transition.
instructions: 1. Perform a push-up, 2. Rotate into a side plank lifting one arm, 3. Hold briefly, 4. Return to push-up position, 5. Repeat alternating sides.

name: Quad Stretch
description: Stretches the quadriceps and hip flexors to improve flexibility and prevent anterior thigh tightness.
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg, 2. Grab your ankle behind you, 3. Pull heel toward glutes, 4. Keep knees together and torso upright, 5. Hold and switch sides.

name: Round The World Stretch
description: Dynamic mobility drill opening up the shoulders, chest, and lats through circular arm patterns.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height, 3. Slowly circle your arms forward in large circles, 4. After a set number of reps, reverse the direction.

name: Seated Calf Stretch
description: Elongates the calves and soleus muscles to enhance ankle dorsiflexion and calf flexibility.
instructions: 1. Sit with one leg extended straight and the other bent, 2. Flex the ankle of the extended leg by pulling toes toward you, 3. Lean forward gently from the hips to deepen the stretch, 4. Hold for the desired time, then switch legs.

name: Push Ups (Single Arm)
description: An advanced unilateral push-up developing chest, triceps, and core while challenging stability and balance.
instructions: 1. Get into a high plank position with one hand on the ground and the other behind your back, 2. Lower your chest toward the ground by bending the elbow of the supporting arm, 3. Keep your core tight and body straight, 4. Push back up to the starting position.

name: Donkey Kick
description: A bodyweight glute exercise performed on all fours by kicking one leg upward while keeping the knee bent.
instructions: 1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips, 2. Keeping the knee bent, lift one leg up toward the ceiling until the thigh is parallel with the floor, 3. Lower the leg back to the start without touching the floor, 4. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Bosu Ball Balance
description: Standing on a Bosu ball to improve balance and ankle strength.
instructions: 1. Stand on a Bosu ball, focusing on maintaining balance, 2. Engage your core, 3. Hold for a set amount of time, 4. Lower off the Bosu ball, 5. Repeat.

name: Bosu Ball Balance (Single Leg)
description: Standing on one leg on a Bosu ball for extra balance challenge.
instructions: 1. Stand on a Bosu ball with one leg, 2. Focus on balancing and engaging your core, 3. Hold for a set time, 4. Switch legs, 5. Repeat.

name: Box Jumps (Lateral)
description: Develops lateral explosive power, coordination, and lower body strength, primarily working the quads, glutes, and calves.
instructions: 1. Stand next to a box, 2. Jump sideways onto the box, 3. Land with both feet, 4. Step down carefully, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Iron Cross
description: Expands and strengthens the chest and shoulders through a wide-arc cable fly motion.
instructions: 1. Stand between two high cable pulleys, 2. Grab handles and extend arms to the side, 3. Bring arms downward in an arc in front of your body, 4. Return to start.

name: Cable Iron Cross (Single Arm)
description: Isolates the chest and front deltoid unilaterally to correct imbalances and enhance range of motion.
instructions: 1. Stand to the side of a high pulley, 2. Grab the handle and extend arm to the side, 3. Pull arm diagonally down and across your body, 4. Return and repeat.

name: Cable Triceps Extension (Lying)
description: Isolates the triceps with constant tension during horizontal elbow extension.
instructions: 1. Lie on a bench under a low cable, 2. Hold the handle and extend arm upward, 3. Bend elbow to lower, 4. Extend again.

name: Cable Tricep Extension (Single Arm)
description: Targets the triceps with unilateral resistance to improve symmetry and control.
instructions: 1. Stand facing a high pulley with one hand on the handle, 2. Extend your arm downward, 3. Slowly bend and repeat, 4. Switch arms.

name: Cable Preacher Curl
description: Focuses on biceps isolation with constant tension and minimized shoulder involvement.
instructions: 1. Sit at a preacher bench and grab a low cable bar, 2. Curl the bar toward your shoulders, 3. Squeeze at the top, 4. Lower slowly.

name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
description: Strengthens the rear deltoids and upper back to support posture and shoulder health.
instructions: 1. Stand between two low cables, 2. Grab opposite handles and extend arms in front, 3. Pull handles outward in a reverse fly motion, 4. Return with control.

name: Cable Reverse Crunch
description: Activates the lower abdominals and hip flexors with controlled cable resistance.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back and hold a low cable between your ankles, 2. Curl your hips upward, 3. Squeeze abs at the top, 4. Lower slowly.

name: Cable Crunches (Seated)
description: Targets the rectus abdominis with weighted spinal flexion for core strength development.
instructions: 1. Sit at a cable machine with rope overhead, 2. Hold the rope behind your head, 3. Crunch forward by contracting your abs, 4. Return to start.

name: Cable Drag Curl
description: Isolates the biceps brachii using constant cable tension with a dragging motion to enhance muscle definition and peak.
instructions: 1. Attach a straight bar to a low pulley, 2. Stand facing the machine and grab the bar, 3. Pull it up your body by dragging elbows back, 4. Squeeze biceps, 5. Lower and repeat.

name: Cable High Bicep Curl
description: Emphasizes the upper portion of the biceps for a higher peak and overall arm development using constant cable tension.
instructions: 1. Set cables at shoulder height, 2. Grab handles with arms extended out, 3. Curl both arms toward your head, 4. Squeeze biceps, 5. Return to start.

name: Cable Lat Pulldown (Single Arm)
description: Isolates the lats unilaterally to promote back symmetry and shoulder joint control.
instructions: 1. Sit at a pulldown machine, 2. Grab one handle with palm facing forward, 3. Pull it down to your shoulder, 4. Slowly return, 5. Switch arms.

name: Cable Side Leg Raise (Standing)
description: Work the outer thighs and glutes by lifting one leg sideways using a cable machine.
instructions: 1. Attach ankle strap to low pulley, 2. Stand upright with strap on outer ankle, 3. Lift leg outward, 4. Lower and repeat.

name: Cable Crunche
description: Perform a crunch movement using a cable machine to strengthen the abdominal muscles.
instructions: 1. Attach rope handle to high pulley, 2. Kneel and grasp the rope, 3. Crunch forward, bringing elbows to knees, 4. Return to start and repeat.

name: Cable Bicep Curl
description: Use a cable machine to perform bicep curls, providing constant tension throughout the movement.
instructions: 1. Stand facing a cable machine with the handle attached to the low pulley, 2. Grab the handle with an underhand grip, 3. Curl the handle toward your shoulders, 4. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Bicep Curl (Single Arm)
description: Perform single-arm cable bicep curls for focused bicep isolation and symmetry.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with the handle at the low pulley, 2. Grab the handle with one hand and curl it toward your shoulder, 3. Lower the handle back down slowly, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Bar Bicep Curl
description: Perform bicep curls with a bar attachment on a cable machine, providing steady resistance.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the low pulley, 2. Grab the bar with an underhand grip, 3. Curl the bar toward your shoulders, 4. Lower it back down slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Bar Bicep Curl (Reverse)
description: Reverse grip curls on a cable machine with a bar to engage the forearms and biceps.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the low pulley, 2. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, 3. Curl the bar toward your shoulders, 4. Lower it back down slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Hammer Curl (Rope)
description: Perform hammer curls with a rope attachment to emphasize the brachialis and forearms.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with a rope attachment on the low pulley, 2. Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other, 3. Curl the rope toward your shoulders, 4. Slowly lower the rope back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Hammer Curl (Rope & Single Arm)
alias_2: Single Arm Cable Rope Hammer Curl
description: Single-arm hammer curls using a cable machine with a rope for increased bicep and forearm engagement.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with the rope attachment on the low pulley, 2. Grab the rope with one hand, palms facing each other, 3. Curl the rope toward your shoulder, 4. Lower it back down slowly, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Chest Press
description: Chest press using a cable machine for constant tension and enhanced chest development.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with the cables set at chest height, 2. Grab the handles with an overhand grip, 3. Step forward and press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended, 4. Slowly bring the handles back toward your chest, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Chest Press (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm chest press using cables to isolate the chest and improve muscle balance.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with one cable set at chest height, 2. Grab the handle with one hand, 3. Press the handle forward until your arm is fully extended, 4. Slowly bring the handle back toward your chest, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Fly
description: Chest fly exercise using cables to stretch and contract the chest for full range activation.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with the cables set at shoulder height, 2. Grab the handles with an overhand grip, 3. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, 4. Slowly open your arms wide, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, 5. Bring your arms back together, 6. Repeat.

name: Cable Fly (Decline)
description: Decline cable fly targeting the lower chest and increasing muscle activation in the lower pectorals.
instructions: 1. Set the cables to a higher than shoulder height position, 2. Stand facing away form the machine, holding the handles, 3. Extend your arms in front of you, 4. Slowly open your arms wide, 5. Bring your arms back together, 6. Repeat.

name: Cable Crossover
description: Cable crossover for chest, focusing on a wide range of motion to target all parts of the chest.
instructions: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with cables at the highest setting, 2. Grab the handles with an overhand grip, 3. Step forward and pull the handles together in front of you, 4. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Glute Kickback
description: Standing kickbacks using a cable machine to isolate the glutes and hamstrings by extending one leg backward.
instructions: 1. Attach an ankle strap to the low pulley of a cable machine, 2. Strap it to your ankle and face the machine, 3. Kick your leg back and upward, keeping your knee straight, 4. Slowly return your leg to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Cable RDL
description: Romanian deadlifts with a cable machine to strengthen the hamstrings and glutes while keeping a slight bend in the knees.
instructions: 1. Attach a rope to the low pulley of a cable machine, 2. Stand with your back straight and knees slightly bent, 3. Hold the rope in front of your thighs, 4. Hinge at your hips and lower the rope toward the ground, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Cable Woodchopper
description: A cable machine exercise where you rotate the torso, pulling the cable diagonally from a high to low position to target the obliques and core.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the highest setting, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Grab the handle with both hands, 4. Pull the cable diagonally down across your body, 5. Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Cable Rotation
description: Rotational movement using a resistance band to target the obliques and core, twisting the torso to work the muscles effectively.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the middle height, 2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Hold the cable handle with both hands in front of you, 4. Rotate your torso to one side, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat on the other side.

name: Cable Lateral Raise
description: Cable-based lateral shoulder raise maintaining constant tension.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the lowest setting with the handle attached, 2. Stand sideways to the machine, 3. Grab the handle with the hand farthest from the machine, 4. Raise your arm out to the side until it is parallel to the ground, 5. Lower the arm back down, 6. Repeat on the other side.

name: Cable Lateral Raise (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm cable raise isolating the lateral deltoid.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the lowest setting with the handle attached, 2. Stand sideways to the machine, 3. Grab the handle with one hand, 4. Raise your arm out to the side until it is parallel to the ground, 5. Lower the arm back down, 6. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Front Raise
description: Cable lift straight forward strengthening the front shoulders.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the lowest setting with the handle attached, 2. Stand facing the machine, 3. Grab the handle with both hands, 4. Raise the cable straight in front of you until your arms are parallel to the ground, 5. Lower the cable back down, 6. Repeat.

name: Cable Front Raise (Single Arm)
description: One-arm cable front raise isolating front deltoid movement.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the lowest setting with the handle attached, 2. Stand facing the machine, 3. Grab the handle with one hand, 4. Raise the cable straight in front of you until your arm is parallel to the ground, 5. Lower the cable back down, 6. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Face Pull
description: Cable pull toward the face strengthening rear delts and upper traps.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to face height with a rope attachment, 2. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Grab the rope with both hands, 4. Pull the rope towards your face, leading with your elbows, 5. Slowly return to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Cable Shoulder Press
description: Overhead press with cables emphasizing shoulder muscle engagement.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to shoulder height with handles attached, 2. Stand facing away from the machine with a handle in each hand, 3. Press both handles overhead until your arms are fully extended, 4. Lower the handles back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Shoulder Press (Single Arm)
description: One-arm overhead cable press improving shoulder isolation.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to shoulder height with a handle attached, 2. Stand facing away from the machine with one handle in one hand, 3. Press the handle overhead until your arm is fully extended, 4. Lower the handle back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Tricep Pushdown
description: Pushing a cable attachment down to work the triceps.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the highest setting with a bar attachment, 2. Grab the bar with both hands, palms facing down, 3. Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Bar Pushdown
description: Using a straight bar cable attachment to push down for triceps.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the highest setting with a straight bar attached, 2. Grab the bar with both hands, palms facing down, 3. Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Rope Overhead Tricep Extension
description: Overhead cable rope movement extending the arms to target triceps.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the lowest setting with a rope attachment, 2. Grab the rope with both hands, facing away from the machine, 3. Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows stationary, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Bar Overhead Tricep Extension
alias_1: Cable Overhead Tricep Press with Bar
description: Overhead extension using a cable straight bar for tricep development.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the lowest setting with a bar attachment, 2. Grab the bar with both hands, facing away from the machine, 3. Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows stationary, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Pushdown (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm cable pushdown to isolate tricep strength.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the highest setting with a handle attached, 2. Grab the handle with one hand, 3. Push the handle down until your arm is fully extended, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Tricep Kickback (Single Arm)
description: Extend your arm backward using a cable to target the tricep.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to a low setting with a handle attached, 2. Grab the handle with one hand, 3. Extend your arm backward, keeping your elbow stationary, 4. Return to the starting position

name: Cable Tricep Pushown (Reverse)
description: Push a cable bar down with palms facing up to work triceps and forearms.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to a high setting with a rope attachment, 2. Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing up, 3. Push the rope down, extending your arms fully, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Reverse Fly
description: Pull cable handles apart at chest height to work rear shoulders and upper back.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to a high setting with a handle attached, 2. Grab the handle with both hands, 3. Pull the handles apart while keeping your arms slightly bent, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Reverse Fly (Single Arm)
description: One-arm version pulling a cable handle back to target the rear delts.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to a high setting with a handle attached, 2. Grab the handle with one hand, 3. Pull the handle across your body, keeping your arm slightly bent, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Cable Seated Row
description: Sit and pull a cable handle toward your body to strengthen the back and arms.
instructions: 1. Sit at the cable machine with your feet flat and your knees slightly bent, 2. Grab the handle with both hands, 3. Pull the handle towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Seated Row (Wide Grip)
description: Pull a wide-grip cable attachment toward your chest to work upper back and arms.
instructions: 1. Sit at the cable machine with your feet flat and knees slightly bent, 2. Grab the wide grip attachment, 3. Pull the handle towards your torso, keeping your elbows wide, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Pull Apart
description: Use a cable machine to pull handles apart, targeting the rear shoulders and back.
instructions: 1. Set a cable machine with a rope attachment at chest height, 2. Grab the rope with both hands, 3. Pull the rope apart, keeping your arms slightly bent, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Lat Pulldown (Close-Grip)
description: A close-grip version of the lat pulldown for deeper lat and arm activation.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine with a close-grip bar, 2. Grab the bar with your hands about shoulder-width apart, 3. Pull the bar down to your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Seated Row (Single Arm)
description: A cable row using one arm to work the back and stabilize the core.
instructions: 1. Sit at the cable machine with the handle attached to the low pulley, 2. Grab the handle with one hand, 3. Pull the handle toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
description: Dumbbell Bicep Curls: Perform alternating bicep curls with dumbbells to target the biceps and forearms.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward, 2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, 3. Lower back down slowly and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl (Alternating)
description: Perform alternating dumbbell bicep curls to work each arm independently.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward, 2. Curl one dumbbell toward your shoulder, 3. Lower it and repeat with the other arm, 4. Alternate between arms.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl (Seated)
description: Sit on a bench and perform bicep curls with dumbbells, focusing on form and control.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with dumbbells in both hands, palms facing forward, 2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, 3. Lower back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
description: Perform curls with dumbbells in a neutral grip to target the brachialis and forearms.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inward, 2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, 3. Lower back down slowly and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl (Alternating)
description: Alternate dumbbell hammer curls to target the brachialis and forearms, one arm at a time.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inward, 2. Curl one dumbbell toward your shoulder, 3. Lower it and repeat with the other arm, 4. Alternate between arms.

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl (Seated)
description: Sit on a bench and perform alternating hammer curls with dumbbells to target the forearms.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with dumbbells in both hands, palms facing inward, 2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, 3. Lower back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl (Reverse)
description: Perform reverse curls with dumbbells to target the brachioradialis and forearms.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing down, 2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, 3. Lower back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl (Single Arm)
description: Isolated single-arm dumbbell curls, focusing on peak bicep contraction.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench, leaning slightly forward, 2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing upward, 3. Curl the dumbbell toward your shoulder, 4. Lower the dumbbell back down slowly, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Spider Curl
description: Perform curls while lying face down on an incline bench to increase bicep isolation.
instructions: 1. Lie face down on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand, 2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, 3. Lower them back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Cross-Body Hammer Curl
description: Cross-body hammer curls with dumbbells to engage the brachialis and biceps.
