instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inward, 2. Curl one dumbbell toward the opposite shoulder, 3. Lower it back down, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curls (Incline)
description: Dumbbell curls on an incline bench, stretching the biceps and focusing on lower bicep activation.
instructions: 1. Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing upward, 2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, 3. Slowly lower them back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Calf Raise
description: Raise your heels while holding dumbbells to strengthen and develop the calf muscles.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, standing on the balls of your feet, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Calf Raise (Single Leg)
description: Isolated single-leg calf raises with dumbbells to target each calf independently.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in one hand, 2. Raise one heel off the ground, standing on the ball of that foot, 3. Lower your heel back down slowly, 4. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
description: A variation of the bench press using dumbbells for greater range of motion and chest activation.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward, 2. Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbells slowly to your chest, 4. Press them back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Incline)
description: An incline dumbbell bench press that targets the upper chest and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Set the bench to an incline position, 2. Lie back on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward, 3. Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended, 4. Lower the dumbbells slowly to your chest, 5. Press them back up, 6. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Decline)
description: A decline dumbbell bench press to emphasize the lower chest and triceps.
instructions: 1. Set the bench to a decline position, 2. Lie back on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward, 3. Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended, 4. Lower the dumbbells slowly to your lower chest, 5. Press them back up, 6. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm dumbbell press focusing on chest activation and improving unilateral strength.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand, 2. Press the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbell slowly to your chest, 4. Press it back up, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Pullover
description: A dumbbell exercise for the chest and back, emphasizing stretch and contraction of the upper body.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell held in both hands, 2. Extend your arms overhead, 3. Lower the dumbbell back behind your head in a controlled manner, 4. Bring the dumbbell back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Pullover (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm dumbbell pullover for better unilateral chest and back activation.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand, 2. Extend your arm overhead, 3. Lower the dumbbell behind your head, 4. Bring the dumbbell back to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Fly
description: Chest fly with dumbbells to target the chest muscles by opening and closing the arms.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other, 2. Extend your arms straight above you, 3. Slowly open your arms wide, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, 4. Bring your arms back together, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
description: Lying on the floor, press dumbbells to target the chest while minimizing shoulder strain.
instructions: 1. Lie on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward, 2. Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbells until your upper arms touch the floor, 4. Press the dumbbells back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm floor press with dumbbells, emphasizing unilateral chest strength and stability.
instructions: 1. Lie on the floor with a dumbbell in one hand, 2. Press the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbell until your upper arm touches the floor, 4. Press the dumbbell back up, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
description: Wrist curl exercise with dumbbells to strengthen the forearm flexors and improve grip strength.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your thighs and palms facing up, 2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, 3. Curl your wrists upwards, 4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
description: Reverse wrist curls with dumbbells to target the forearm extensors and improve wrist strength.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your thighs and palms facing down, 2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, 3. Curl your wrists upwards, 4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Farmer's Walk
description: Walking while holding heavy dumbbells to strengthen the grip, forearms, and core stability.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Stand tall with your chest up, 3. Walk forward while keeping your core engaged, 4. Walk for a set distance or time, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Hip Thrust
description: Hip thrust with a dumbbell placed on the hips for glute and hamstring activation.
instructions: 1. Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench, 2. Hold a dumbbell on your hips, 3. Drive through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling, 4. Lower your hips back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Hip Thrust (Single Leg)
description: Single-leg dumbbell hip thrust to target each glute and hamstring individually for greater balance and strength.
instructions: 1. Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench, 2. Hold a dumbbell on your hips, 3. Lift one leg off the ground and drive through the other heel to lift your hips, 4. Lower your hips back down, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Dumbbell RDL
description: Romanian deadlifts with dumbbells to target the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back with a controlled hinge motion.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Hinge at your hips and lower the dumbbells toward the ground, 3. Keep your back straight and knees slightly bent, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Staggered Stance RDL
description: A staggered stance variation of Romanian deadlifts with dumbbells to target the hamstrings and glutes.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Stand with one foot slightly in front of the other, 3. Hinge at your hips and lower the dumbbells toward the ground, 4. Keep your back straight and knees slightly bent, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
description: Holding a dumbbell close to the chest while performing squats to target the quads, hamstrings, and glutes.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell with both hands at chest level, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees, 4. Drive through your heels to stand back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Lunge
description: Lateral lunges with dumbbells to engage the quads, glutes, and inner thighs.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Step to the side with one leg and bend that knee, 3. Push your hips back and lower your body, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Kettlebell Lateral Lunge
description: Lateral lunges using a kettlebell to engage the legs, glutes, and core in a wide stance.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell with both hands, 2. Step to the side with one leg and bend that knee, 3. Push your hips back and lower your body, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Lunge
description: Lunges with dumbbells to enhance lower body strength, focusing on quads, hamstrings, and glutes.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90 degrees, 3. Push back to the starting position, 4. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Bulgarian split squats using dumbbells for unilateral leg strength and balance.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Position one leg behind you on a bench, 3. Lower your body by bending your front knee, 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Dumbbell Sumo Squat
description: Wide stance squats with a dumbbell to target the inner thighs, glutes, and quads.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell with both hands between your legs, 2. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed outward, 3. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees, 4. Push through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Step Up
description: Step-ups using dumbbells to strengthen the legs and glutes while enhancing balance.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Step up onto a bench or platform with one leg, 3. Drive through your heel to bring the other leg up, 4. Step down with the same leg, 5. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Dumbbell Split Squat
description: Split squats using dumbbells held at the sides to strengthen the quads, glutes, and hamstrings while focusing on unilateral leg strength.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Position one leg behind you 3. Lower your body by bending your front knee, 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position

name: Dumbbell Russian Twist
description: A variation of the Russian twist using a dumbbell to target the obliques and core by twisting the torso side to side while seated.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, 2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, 3. Lean back slightly and twist your torso from side to side, 4. Touch the dumbbell to the ground next to your hip on each side, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Scaption
description: Lifting dumbbells in a 30-45 degree angle from the torso (in the scapular plane) to strengthen the deltoids and shoulder stabilizers.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Raise your arms in front of you at a 30-degree angle, 3. Continue raising the dumbbells until your arms are parallel to the ground, 4. Lower back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press (Standing)
description: Pressing dumbbells overhead from shoulder height while standing to strengthen the shoulders and triceps.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, 2. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press (Single Arm)
description: Overhead pressing one dumbbell at a time while standing, adding a core stabilization challenge.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height, 2. Press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press (Seated)
description: Performing a dumbbell shoulder press while seated to isolate the shoulders and reduce momentum.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, 2. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Arnold Press
description: Rotational overhead press targeting all heads of the deltoids.
instructions: 1. Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing you, 2. Press the dumbbells overhead, rotating your palms forward as you lift, 3. Lower the dumbbells back down and rotate your palms back towards you, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Arnold Press (Seated)
description: Seated version of the Arnold Press emphasizing strict shoulder strength.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing you, 2. Press the dumbbells overhead, rotating your palms forward as you lift, 3. Lower the dumbbells back down and rotate your palms back towards you, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Arnold Press (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm version of Arnold Press for unilateral shoulder development.
instructions: 1. Sit or stand with a dumbbell in one hand, palm facing you, 2. Press the dumbbell overhead, rotating your palm forward as you lift, 3. Lower the dumbbell back down and rotate your palm back towards you, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: Raises dumbbells sideways to target the lateral deltoids.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground, 3. Lower back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm lateral raises isolating one shoulder at a time.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in one hand at your side, 2. Raise your arm out to the side until it is parallel to the ground, 3. Lower back down, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
description: Lifts dumbbells straight forward to strengthen the front shoulders.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Raise both dumbbells straight in front of you until they are parallel to the ground, 3. Lower the dumbbells back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Front Raise (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm front raise focusing on anterior deltoid strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with a dumbbell in one hand at your side, 2. Raise the dumbbell straight in front of you until it is parallel to the ground, 3. Lower the dumbbell back down, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Cuban Press
description: Dumbbell rotation to press movement targeting rotator cuff and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, 2. Rotate your arms outward, 3. Press the dumbbells overhead while keeping your elbows bent at 90 degrees, 4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
description: Lifting shoulders upward while holding dumbbells to work traps.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, 3. Lower your shoulders back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Skullcrusher
description: Lying tricep exercise lowering dumbbells toward the forehead.
instructions: 1. Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other, 2. Lower the dumbbells to your forehead by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Skullcrusher (Single Arm)
description: One-arm version of skullcrushers isolating tricep strength.
instructions: 1. Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand, 2. Lower the dumbbell to your forehead by bending your elbow, 3. Extend your arm back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Tricep Extension
description: Lifting and lowering dumbbells overhead to strengthen triceps.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell with both hands above your head, elbows bent, 2. Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Kickback (Single Arm)
description: Bending over and extending one dumbbell backward to isolate the tricep.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in one hand, bend your knees slightly, and hinge forward, 2. Extend your arm back while keeping your elbow stationary, 3. Return to the starting position

name: Dumbbell Bent Over Row
alias_1: DB Single Arm Bent Over Row
alias_2: Single Arm Dumbbell Bent Over Row
description: Bend at the hips and pull dumbbells toward your sides to build back muscles.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward, 3. Row the dumbbells towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Bent Over Row (Single Arm)
description: One-arm version pulling a dumbbell toward your waist while bent over.
instructions: 1. Place one knee and hand on a bench, 2. Hold a dumbbell with your free hand, 3. Row the dumbbell towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Fly
description: Moving dumbbells outward in a bent-over position to focus on the rear delts and upper back.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips, 3. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells out to the sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Fly (Singe Arm)
description: A one-arm version of the reverse fly to isolate each rear shoulder and back.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand, 2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, 3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell to the side, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Squat to Press
description: Performing a squat followed by an overhead press with dumbbells.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, 2. Perform a squat by lowering your body down, 3. As you stand up, press the dumbbells overhead, 4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulders and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Clean to Press
description: Cleaning dumbbells up to the shoulders, then pressing overhead.
instructions: 1. Start with dumbbells in front of your thighs, 2. Perform a clean by lifting the dumbbells to shoulder height, 3. From the clean position, press the dumbbells overhead, 4. Lower back to the starting position and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Squat to Curl to Press
description: Combining a squat, a bicep curl, and an overhead press into one fluid movement.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Perform a squat, 3. As you stand, curl the dumbbells to your shoulders, 4. Press the dumbbells overhead, 5. Lower back to the starting position and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Step Ups to Shoulder Press
description: Stepping up onto a box and pressing weights overhead at the top.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, 2. Step onto a bench or platform with one foot, 3. As you step up, press the dumbbells overhead, 4. Lower back down and repeat on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Curls To Shoulder Press
description: Performing a bicep curl that transitions into a shoulder press.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Curl the dumbbells to your shoulders, 3. Press the dumbbells overhead, 4. Lower them back to your shoulders and then your sides, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Lunge to Shoulder Press
description: Lunging forward and pressing dumbbells overhead simultaneously.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, 2. Step forward into a lunge, 3. As you stand up, press the dumbbells overhead, 4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height and repeat on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Lunge to Curls to Shoulder Press
description: A full-body combo of a lunge, curl, and overhead press.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Step forward into a lunge, 3. As you lunge, curl the dumbbells to your shoulders, 4. Press the dumbbells overhead, 5. Lower back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press (Alternating)
description: Builds unilateral chest, shoulder, and tricep strength while reducing shoulder strain.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with dumbbells in hand and knees bent, 2. Press one dumbbell toward the ceiling while the other stays near your chest, 3. Lower the raised dumbbell and press the other, 4. Alternate arms with control.

name: Dumbbell Clean and Press (Alternating)
description: Develops explosive strength in legs and shoulders while improving coordination and balance.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Dip your hips and pull the dumbbell to shoulder height, 3. Press overhead, 4. Lower and repeat with the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Fly (Decline)
description: Targets the lower chest (sternal head of pectorals) to build chest width and definition.
instructions: 1. Lie on a decline bench with dumbbells in each hand, 2. Extend arms above chest with slight elbow bend, 3. Lower arms out to sides in an arc, 4. Bring them back up by squeezing your chest, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Fly (Incline)
description: Targets the upper chest by opening the arms in a wide arc while lying on an incline bench.
instructions: 1. Lie on an incline bench holding dumbbells, 2. Extend arms above chest, 3. Lower dumbbells in a wide arc until you feel a stretch, 4. Bring them back up to starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Drag Curl
description: Primarily targets the biceps brachii with a unique pulling motion to maximize peak contraction and muscle growth.
instructions: 1. Hold dumbbells at your sides, 2. Drag them up your torso by pulling elbows back, 3. Squeeze biceps at the top, 4. Lower back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Side Bend
description: Targets the obliques to strengthen the core and improve lateral trunk stability.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side, 2. Bend sideways at the waist toward the dumbbell, 3. Return to upright position, 4. Complete reps then switch sides, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Push Up
description: A push-up performed with hands on dumbbells to reduce wrist strain and increase depth.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand on the floor and get into a plank position, 2. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows, 3. Keep your body straight and core tight, 4. Push back up to the start.

name: Dumbbell Renegade Row
description: Strengthens the upper back, lats, and core through a plank-position dumbbell row.
instructions: 1. Get into a push-up position with a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Row one dumbbell up to your side while balancing on the other, 3. Lower and repeat with the opposite arm, 4. Keep core engaged throughout.

name: EZ Bar Bicep Curl
description: Perform bicep curls with an EZ bar to target the biceps with a comfortable grip.
instructions: 1. Stand with an EZ bar in both hands, palms facing forward, 2. Curl the bar toward your shoulders, 3. Lower the bar slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: EZ Bar Bicep Curl (Reverse)
description: Reverse grip bicep curls using an EZ bar to engage the forearms and biceps.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar with an overhand grip, 2. Curl the bar toward your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary, 3. Lower the bar back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: EZ Bar Preacher Curl
description: Preacher curls with an EZ bar to reduce arm movement and focus on bicep contraction.
instructions: 1. Sit on the preacher curl bench with your upper arms resting on the pad, 2. Grab the EZ bar with an underhand grip, 3. Curl the bar toward your shoulders, 4. Lower the bar back down slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: EZ Bar Skullcrusher
description: Tricep exercise with an EZ curl bar lowering weight toward forehead.
instructions: 1. Lie on a bench with an EZ bar in each hand, palms facing each other, 2. Lower the EZ bar to your forehead by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: EZ Bar Bench Press To Skullcrusher
description: Works the chest (pectorals), shoulders (anterior deltoids), and triceps to build upper body pushing strength and arm extension.
instructions: 1. Lie on a bench holding an EZ bar above your chest, 2. Lower the bar to your chest like a bench press, 3. Press it up, then lower it behind your head for a skullcrusher, 4. Extend your arms to return, 5. Repeat both movements in sequence.

name: Kettlebell Bicep Curl
description: Bicep curls performed using kettlebells, adding unique resistance dynamics to the exercise.
instructions: 1. Stand with a kettlebell in each hand, palms facing upward, 2. Curl the kettlebells toward your shoulders, 3. Lower them back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Calf Raise
description: Calf raises using kettlebells for added resistance to increase calf strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with a kettlebell in each hand, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, standing on the balls of your feet, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Calf Raise (Single Leg)
description: Single-leg calf raises with kettlebells, targeting each calf independently for balanced strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with a kettlebell in one hand, 2. Raise one heel off the ground, standing on the ball of that foot, 3. Lower your heel back down slowly, 4. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Kettlebell Pullover
description: Kettlebell pullover engaging the chest and back for a full upper-body stretch and contraction.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with a kettlebell held in both hands, 2. Extend your arms overhead, 3. Lower the kettlebell back behind your head, 4. Bring the kettlebell back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Pullover (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm kettlebell pullover, focusing on one side of the chest and back at a time.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on a bench with a kettlebell in one hand, 2. Extend your arm overhead, 3. Lower the kettlebell back behind your head, 4. Bring the kettlebell back to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Kettlebell Farmer's Walk
description: Walking with kettlebells to build grip strength, forearms, and overall endurance.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides, 2. Stand tall with your chest up, 3. Walk forward while keeping your core engaged, 4. Walk for a set distance or time, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Swing
description: Swinging a kettlebell from between the legs to chest height, engaging the hips, glutes, and core.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a kettlebell in front of you, 2. Hinge at your hips and grab the kettlebell with both hands, 3. Swing the kettlebell back between your legs, 4. Drive your hips forward to swing the kettlebell up, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Squat
description: Goblet squats using a kettlebell to enhance squat depth and focus on leg and glute activation.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell with both hands at chest level, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees, 4. Drive through your heels to stand back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Lunge
description: Lunges using a kettlebell to engage the lower body muscles and improve coordination and strength.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides, 2. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90 degrees, 3. Push back to the starting position, 4. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Kettlebell Bulbarian Split Squat
description: Bulgarian split squats with a kettlebell to increase leg strength and mobility in a single-leg stance.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides, 2. Position one leg behind you on a bench, 3. Lower your body by bending your front knee, 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Kettlebell Sumo Squat
description: Wide stance squats with a kettlebell to engage the inner thighs, glutes, and quads.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell with both hands between your legs, 2. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed outward, 3. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees, 4. Push through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Step Up
description: Step-ups holding kettlebells to target the quads, glutes, and hamstrings while improving coordination.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides, 2. Step up onto a bench or platform with one leg, 3. Drive through your heel to bring the other leg up, 4. Step down with the same leg, 5. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Kettlebell Split Squat
description: Split squats with a kettlebell in each hand or a single kettlebell held at the chest to engage the quads, glutes, and improve balance and coordination.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides, 2. Position one leg behind you, 3. Lower your body by bending your front knee, 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Kettlebell Russain Twist
description: A Russian twist performed with a kettlebell to target the obliques and core, rotating from side to side while seated.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, 2. Hold a kettlebell with both hands, 3. Lean back slightly and twist your torso from side to side, 4. Touch the kettlebell to the ground next to your hip on each side, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Shoulder Press
description: Overhead press using kettlebells to work shoulders and core.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold a kettlebell in one hand at shoulder height, 3. Press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is fully extended, 4. Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Kettlebell Shoulder Press (Single Arm)
description: One-arm kettlebell press focusing on shoulder and core strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold a kettlebell in one hand at shoulder height, 3. Press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is fully extended, 4. Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Kettlebell Shoulder Press (Seated)
description: Seated kettlebell press targeting shoulders with extra stability.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with back support, 2. Hold a kettlebell in one hand at shoulder height, 3. Press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is fully extended, 4. Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Kettlebell Shrug
description: Shoulder shrug with kettlebells targeting trap muscles.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides, 2. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, 3. Lower your shoulders back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Overhead Tricep Extension
description: Overhead tricep exercise using kettlebells for resistance.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell with both hands above your head, elbows bent, 2. Lower the kettlebell behind your head by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Bent Over Row (Single Arm)
alias_1: One Arm KB Bent Over Row
description: Row a kettlebell toward your waist while bent over to target the back.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand, 2. Hinge forward at the hips, 3. Row the kettlebell towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Kettlebell Clean and Press
description: Cleaning a kettlebell to the rack position and pressing it overhead.
instructions: 1. Start with a kettlebell on the floor between your feet, 2. Perform a clean by lifting the kettlebell to shoulder height, 3. Press the kettlebell overhead, 4. Lower it back down to shoulder height and then back to the floor, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Clean and Press (Alternating)
description: Full-body power move combining posterior chain activation with shoulder and tricep pressing.
instructions: 1. Start with a kettlebell on the floor between your feet, 2. Clean the kettlebell to shoulder height, 3. Press it overhead, 4. Lower and switch arms.

name: Kettlebell Push Up
description: A push-up variation performed with hands gripping kettlebell handles to increase range of motion and stability challenge.
instructions: 1. Place two kettlebells shoulder-width apart on the floor, grip the handles and get into a plank position, 2. Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows, 3. Keep your body in a straight line and core engaged, 4. Push back up to the starting position.

name: Landmine Chest Press
description: Chest press using a landmine attachment to target the chest with a diagonal pressing motion.
instructions: 1. Place one end of a barbell in a landmine attachment, 2. Grab the other end of the barbell with both hands, 3. Press the barbell forward until your arms are fully extended, 4. Slowly bring the barbell back toward your chest, 5. Repeat.

name: Landmine Shoulder Press (Single Arm)
description: Angled one-arm press using a barbell landmine setup.
instructions: 1. Place one end of a barbell in a landmine attachment, 2. Stand facing the bar with one hand holding the free end, 3. Press the barbell overhead with one arm, 4. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Landmine Bent Over Row
description: Row one end of a barbell attached to the ground to strengthen the back.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Grab the landmine handle with both hands, 3. Row the handle towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Landmine Bent Over Row (Single Row)
description: Single-arm landmine row for building back and arm strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with one hand on the landmine handle, 2. Row the handle towards your torso with one arm, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 3. Slowly return to the starting position, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Machine Hip Abduction
description: Strengthen outer thighs and hips by pushing legs apart against resistance on the abduction machine.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with knees bent, 2. Adjust the pads to your thighs, 3. Push legs outward, 4. Slowly return to starting position.

name: Machine Hip Adduction
description: Use the machine to squeeze the legs together against resistance, targeting the inner thighs.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with legs placed against the pads, 2. Squeeze legs inward, 3. Slowly release to starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Bicep Curl
description: A machine-assisted bicep curl that isolates the biceps while minimizing arm movement.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your arms on the padded armrest, 2. Grab the handles with an underhand grip, 3. Curl the handles toward your shoulders, 4. Slowly lower the handles back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Preacher Curl
description: Bicep curls performed on a preacher bench to isolate the biceps and reduce momentum.
instructions: 1. Sit on the preacher curl machine, positioning your arms on the pad, 2. Grab the handles with an underhand grip, 3. Curl the handles toward your shoulders, 4. Lower them back down slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Calf Raise
description: Calf raises using a machine to isolate and target the calves with controlled motion.
instructions: 1. Sit on the calf raise machine with your feet on the foot platform, 2. Push through your toes to raise your heels, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Calf Raise (Seated)
description: Seated calf raises on a machine, focusing on the soleus muscle for calf development.
instructions: 1. Sit on the seated calf raise machine, placing your feet on the foot platform, 2. Push through your toes to raise your heels, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Chest Dip
description: A dip movement that targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders for upper body strength.
instructions: 1. Place your hands on parallel bars and lift yourself up, 2. Lower your body slowly by bending your elbows, 3. Lower until your upper arms are parallel to the ground, 4. Push your body back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Assisted Chest Dip
description: Assisted chest dips using a machine to reduce body weight and focus on chest activation.
instructions: 1. Position yourself on the machine with your hands on the dip handles, 2. Use the assisted weight to help lower your body, 3. Lower yourself by bending your elbows, 4. Push back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Chest Press
description: Chest press using a machine to isolate and strengthen the pectoral muscles.
instructions: 1. Sit on the chest press machine, adjusting the seat so the handles are at chest height, 2. Grab the handles and push them forward until your arms are extended, 3. Slowly bring the handles back toward your chest, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Chest Fly
description: Machine-based chest fly focusing on stretching and contracting the pectorals for maximum activation.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with the arms extended, 2. Grab the handles and bring your arms together in front of you, 3. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Chest Press (Incline)
description: Chest press on an incline machine to focus on the upper pectorals with guided movement.
instructions: 1. Sit on the incline chest press machine with your back against the pad, 2. Grab the handles, 3. Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended, 4. Slowly return the handles to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Seated Leg Curl
description: Using a machine to perform seated leg curls, isolating the hamstrings for strength and development.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your legs extended, 2. Place your ankles under the pads, 3. Curl your legs toward your glutes, 4. Slowly release back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Lying Leg Curl
description: Lying leg curls on a machine to target the hamstrings by flexing the knee against resistance.
instructions: 1. Lie face down on the machine with your ankles under the pads, 2. Curl your legs toward your glutes, 3. Slowly release back to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Nordic Hamstring Curl
description: Nordic hamstring curls on a machine to increase hamstring strength by controlling the downward movement.
instructions: 1. Kneel on the machine with your feet anchored, 2. Slowly lower your body forward, keeping your hips extended, 3. Use your hamstrings to pull yourself back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Leg Press
description: Leg press on a machine to target the quads, hamstrings, and glutes by pushing weight with the legs.
instructions: 1. Sit down on the leg press machine and place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform, 2. Push the platform away by extending your legs, 3. Slowly bend your knees to lower the platform back down, 4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Leg Press (Single Leg)
description: Single-leg leg press on a machine to isolate one leg at a time, targeting quads, hamstrings, and glutes.
instructions: 1. Sit on the leg press machine and place one foot on the platform, 2. Push the platform away by extending your leg, 3. Slowly bend your knee to lower the platform back down, 4. Push through your heel to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Machine Hack Squat
description: Hack squats performed on a machine to target the quads and glutes, reducing strain on the lower back.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Lower your body by bending your knees, 3. Push through your heels to return to standing, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Horizontal Leg Press
description: Leg press machine with a horizontal position to target quads, glutes, and hamstrings by pushing weight with the legs.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform, 2. Push the platform away by extending your legs, 3. Slowly bend your knees to lower the platform back down, 4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Back Extension
description: A machine variation of back extensions to strengthen the lower back muscles with controlled movement.
instructions: 1. Sit on the back extension machine with your legs secured, 2. Lower your upper body towards the floor, 3. Raise your body back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Leg Extension
description: Quadriceps-focused movement using a leg extension machine, extending the knees against resistance.
instructions: 1. Sit on the leg extension machine with your feet under the pad, 2. Extend your legs to straighten them, 3. Slowly lower your legs back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Shoulder Press
description: Shoulder pressing exercise using a guided weight machine.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your back supported, 2. Grab the handles or place your hands on the pads, 3. Press the handles overhead until your arms are fully extended, 4. Lower the handles back down to shoulder height, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Rear Delt
description: Machine-based exercise pulling arms backward to target rear shoulders.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad, 2. Grab the handles or place your hands on the pads, 3. Pull the handles or pads out to the side, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Lateral Raise
description: Machine exercise lifting arms sideways to target shoulder sides.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your back supported, 2. Grab the handles or place your arms under the pads, 3. Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground, 4. Lower back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Tricep Extension
description: Machine-guided arm extension working the tricep muscles.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your arms on the pads, 2. Push the handles or pads downward until your arms are fully extended, 3. Slowly return to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Reverse Fly
description: Use a machine to pull arms outward and back, working the rear shoulders and back.
instructions: 1. Sit at the machine with your chest against the pad, 2. Grab the handles, elbows slightly bent, 3. Pull the handles apart, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Pull Ups (Assisted)
description: A pull-up movement with machine support to make lifting easier, targeting back and arms.
instructions: 1. Set the assisted pull-up machine, 2. Grab the handles, 3. Step onto the foot platform, 4. Pull your body upward, as if doing a regular pull-up, 5. Lower yourself back down, 6. Repeat.

name: Machine Lat Pulldown
description: A seated machine movement pulling a bar down to target the upper and mid-back.
instructions: 1. Sit at the machine with the bar attached to the high pulley, 2. Grab the bar with your hands at a wide grip, 3. Pull the bar down to your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Lat Pulldown (Kneeling)
description: A lat pulldown performed from a kneeling position to emphasize the lats.
instructions: 1. Attach a bar or rope to the high pulley of a cable machine, 2. Kneel on the floor and grab the bar or rope, 3. Pull the bar down to your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Prone Row
description: A row exercise lying chest-down, pulling handles to build upper back muscles.
instructions: 1. Lie face down on the machine, grabbing the handles, 2. Pull the handles toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 3. Slowly return the handles to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Seated Row
description: A machine exercise pulling handles toward the body to target the back muscles.
instructions: 1. Sit at the machine with your feet flat on the platform, grabbing the handles, 2. Pull the handles towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 3. Slowly return to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Seated Row (Underhand grip)
description: Seated rowing with palms facing up to engage the arms and back differently.
instructions: 1. Sit at the machine with an underhand grip on the handles, 2. Pull the handles towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 3. Slowly return to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Seated Row (Overhand grip)
description: Seated rowing with palms facing down to focus on the upper back.
instructions: 1. Sit at the machine with an overhand grip on the handles, 2. Pull the handles towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 3. Slowly return to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Seated Row (Single Arm)
description: A one-arm seated row to isolate and strengthen each side of the back.
instructions: 1. Sit at the machine and grab the single handle with one hand, 2. Pull the handle toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 3. Slowly return to the starting position

name: Machine Ab Crunch
description: Isolates the rectus abdominis to strengthen core stability through resisted spinal flexion.
instructions: 1. Sit on the ab crunch machine and adjust the settings so the pads rest comfortably on your shoulders and feet are secure, 2. Grasp the handles or keep your hands on the pads depending on the machine, 3. Engage your core and crunch forward by contracting your abs, bringing your chest toward your knees, 4. Pause briefly at the bottom for peak contraction, 5. Slowly return to the starting position in a controlled motion.

name: Machine Calf Press
description: Targets the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles in the calves to build lower leg strength and definition.
instructions: 1. Sit at the machine with feet on platform, 2. Push the weight using your toes, 3. Squeeze calves at top, 4. Lower heels and repeat.

name: Machine Leg Press Calf Raise
description: Calf raise exercise that targets the gastrocnemius and soleus using a leg press machine footplate for developing lower leg strength and ankle stability.
instructions: 1. Sit on leg press with toes on platform edge, 2. Extend legs and lower heels, 3. Press through the toes to raise heels, 4. Repeat.

name: Machine Leg Press (Narrow Stance)
description: Prioritizes the quadriceps while still engaging glutes and hamstrings during leg extension in a fixed path.
instructions: 1. Sit in the machine with feet close together, 2. Lower the platform slowly, 3. Press through heels to lift, 4. Keep knees aligned, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Leg Press (Wide Stance)
description: Shifts emphasis to glutes and adductors, with quads still active, using a wider foot placement.
instructions: 1. Sit with feet wider than shoulders, 2. Lower the platform slowly, 3. Press up through your heels, 4. Keep knees tracking over feet, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Leg Extension (Single Leg)
description: Isolates the quadriceps one leg at a time to improve strength symmetry and knee extension power.
instructions: 1. Sit on the leg extension machine and position one foot under the padded lever, 2. Extend your leg until it is straight and parallel to the floor, 3. Slowly lower the weight back down, 4. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.

name: Machine Hip Thrust
description: A glute-focused exercise performed using a machine that supports your back while you thrust your hips upward under resistance.
instructions: 1. Sit on the hip thrust machine with your upper back resting on the pad and feet flat on the platform, 2. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until your body is in a straight line, 3. Pause at the top, squeezing your glutes, 4. Slowly lower hips back down.

name: Machine Dip
description: A triceps and chest exercise done on a dip machine that assists bodyweight lowering and pushing movements.
instructions: 1. Grasp the handles on the dip machine and support your body with straight arms, 2. Lower yourself by bending the elbows until the upper arms are parallel to the floor, 3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged, 4. Push back up to the starting position.

name: Medicine Ball Squeeze
description: Squeeze a medicine ball between your knees while lying on your back to activate the inner thighs.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, 2. Hold a medicine ball between your knees, 3. Squeeze the ball as hard as you can, 4. Hold for the desired time, then relax.

name: Medicine Ball Push Up
description: Push-ups with hands on a medicine ball, challenging stability and targeting chest muscles.
instructions: 1. Position your hands on a medicine ball while in a plank position, 2. Lower your body toward the ground by bending your elbows, 3. Push your body back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Medicine Ball Chest Pass
description: Throwing a medicine ball for chest power, engaging the chest and arms with each pass.
instructions: 1. Stand facing a wall or partner holding a medicine ball, 2. Hold the ball at chest height, 3. Throw the ball forcefully with both hands, 4. Catch the ball after it rebounds, 5. Repeat.

name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist
description: Seated twisting movement with a medicine ball, targeting the obliques and core while rotating the torso from side to side.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, 2. Hold a medicine ball with both hands, 3. Lean back slightly and twist your torso from side to side, 4. Touch the ball to the ground next to your hip on each side, 5. Repeat.

name: Medicine Ball Overhead Tricep Extension
description: Overhead extension movement using a medicine ball for triceps.
instructions: 1. Hold a medicine ball with both hands above your head, elbows bent, 2. Lower the ball behind your head by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Cable Lat Pulldown
description: A machine exercise pulling a bar down to work the lat muscles of the back.
instructions: 1. Sit at the cable machine with the bar attached to the high pulley, 2. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, 3. Pull the bar down to your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Lat Pushdown
description: Pressing a cable bar downward to focus on strengthening the lats and arms.
instructions: 1. Attach a rope to the high pulley on a cable machine, 2. Grab the rope with both hands, 3. Pull the rope downward, extending your arms, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Ball Slam
description: Lifting and forcefully slamming a medicine ball to the ground to develop power and cardio.
instructions: 1. Hold a medicine ball overhead, 2. Using your whole body, slam the ball down onto the floor with maximum force, 3. Catch the ball as it rebounds and repeat, 4. Focus on using your core and upper body power.

name: Ball Chest Pass
description: Throwing a medicine ball forward from the chest to work on explosive upper body strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold a medicine ball at chest level, 3. Explosively push the ball forward, releasing it with force, 4. Catch the ball as it returns and repeat.

name: Ball Chest Pass (Wall)
description: Throwing a medicine ball against a wall from the chest for power and coordination.
instructions: 1. Stand facing a wall with feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold the medicine ball at chest level, 3. Throw the ball against the wall with force, 4. Catch the ball as it returns and repeat.

name: Medicine Ball Rotational Throw
description: Throwing a medicine ball with a twist to develop core rotational power.
instructions: 1. Hold a medicine ball with both hands, 2. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and rotate your torso to one side, 3. Explosively rotate to the opposite side and throw the ball against a wall or to a partner, 4. Catch the ball and repeat.

name: Wrist Roller
description: A wrist roller exercise using a weighted rope to strengthen the forearms and improve grip.
instructions: 1. Hold the wrist roller with both hands, 2. Roll the weight up by rotating your wrists, 3. Once the weight reaches the top, slowly lower it back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Tricep Dip
description: Lower and lift your body between bars to work the triceps, chest, and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with your hands resting beside your hips, 2. Place your feet flat on the floor or extend them out in front for more challenge, 3. Lower your body by bending your elbows to about a 90-degree angle, 4. Push back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Balance Board
description: Standing on a wobbling board to improve balance and core strength.
instructions: 1. Stand on a balance board and focus on maintaining stability, 2. Engage your core, 3. Hold for a set amount of time, 4. Lower off the balance board, 5. Repeat.

name: Balance Board (Single Leg)
description: Balancing on one leg on a wobble board to work stability even more.
instructions: 1. Stand on a balance board with one leg, 2. Focus on balance and control, 3. Hold for a set time, 4. Switch legs, 5. Repeat.

name: Foam Roller Extension
description: Stretching over a foam roller to open the thoracic spine.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with a foam roller under your upper back, 2. Gently extend your spine over the roller, 3. Allow your body to open up, 4. Hold the stretch, 5. Repeat if desired.

name: Chest Press Hold
description: Holding the pressing position during a chest press to build isometric strength.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with a dumbbell or barbell in each hand, 2. Press the weight above your chest, 3. Hold the position with your arms extended, 4. Focus on engaging your chest and core.

name: Battle Rope
description: Heavy ropes used for powerful wave, slam, and endurance exercises.
instructions: 1. Hold the battle ropes with both hands, 2. Alternate making large waves with your arms, 3. Keep your core engaged and continue for a set time.

name: Rowing Machine
description: A cardio machine that mimics rowing to work the back, arms, legs, and lungs.
instructions: 1. Sit on the rowing machine with feet secured, 2. Push off with your legs, then pull the handle towards your chest, 3. Extend your arms and slide back forward, 4. Repeat the strokes.

name: Treadmill
description: A machine for walking, jogging, or running in place at adjustable speeds and inclines.
instructions: 1. Walk, jog, or run on the treadmill, 2. Adjust speed and incline to suit your workout.

name: Assult Bike
description: An air-resistance bike that works both the upper and lower body for high-intensity cardio.
instructions: 1. Sit on the bike and start pedaling, 2. Use both your legs and arms to drive the pedals and handlebars, 3. Increase intensity for a full-body workout.

name: Sled Push
description: Pushing a weighted sled across the floor to build strength and power.
instructions: 1. Push a weighted sled across a flat surface, 2. Engage your legs, hips, and core to generate power, 3. Continue pushing for a set distance.

name: Sled Pull
description: Pulling a sled using straps, handles, or a harness to strengthen the posterior chain.
instructions: 1. Attach a harness to the sled, 2. Pull the sled across the ground by walking backward, 3. Engage your legs and core throughout the movement.

name: Jump Rope
description: A simple cardio tool for improving endurance, coordination, and foot speed.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with the rope behind you, 2. Swing the rope over your head and jump when it reaches your feet, 3. Continue jumping and swinging the rope.

name: Wall Ball
description: Throwing a medicine ball against a wall while squatting, combining strength and cardio.
instructions: 1. Stand facing a wall with a medicine ball, 2. Squat down and then explode upward, 3. Throw the ball at the target above, 4. Catch it on the rebound and repeat.

name: Sandbag Clean
description: Lifting a heavy sandbag from the ground to the shoulders to build functional strength.
instructions: 1. Place a sandbag on the floor, 2. Bend your knees and grip the sandbag, 3. Lift the bag to your chest with a fluid motion, 4. Lower it back down and repeat.

name: Stairmaster
description: A cardio machine mimicking stair climbing to target the glutes, quads, and calves.
instructions: 1. Climb stairs using the Stairmaster machine, 2. Keep a steady pace and engage your legs and core throughout the exercise.

name: SkiErg
description: A machine simulating Nordic skiing to strengthen the arms, core, and legs with cardio.
instructions: 1. Grab the handles of the SkiErg machine, 2. Pull the handles down to your hips, using your legs and arms to generate power, 3. Continue the movement for a set time.

name: Spin Bike
description: A stationary bike used for high-intensity cycling workouts.
instructions: 1. Adjust the resistance on the bike, 2. Begin pedaling at a steady pace, 3. Increase intensity by adjusting the resistance or pedaling faster, 4. Continue for a set time or distance, 5. Focus on maintaining a consistent cadence.

name: Battle Rope (Waves)
description: Alternating rope waves up and down to build endurance and shoulder strength.
instructions: 1. Grab both ends of the battle rope, 2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Alternate raising and lowering the ropes to create waves, 4. Engage your core and use your arms and shoulders to generate movement.

name: Battle Rope (Slams)
description: Slamming both ends of the rope down powerfully for explosive power.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ropes, 2. Lift both ropes overhead, 3. Slam the ropes down forcefully onto the ground, 4. Repeat for several reps, 5. Focus on explosive power.

name: Battle Rope Jump Slam
description: Adding a jump into the slam motion for more explosiveness and cardio.
instructions: 1. Begin in a squat position with the battle ropes in hand, 2. Jump as you raise the ropes overhead, 3. Slam the ropes down as you land in a squat, 4. Repeat, ensuring each jump and slam is explosive.

name: Agility Ladder Drill
description: Quick footwork drills using a ladder laid on the ground to develop agility.
instructions: 1. Lay the agility ladder on the ground, 2. Step quickly in and out of the squares in various patterns, 3. Focus on fast footwork and precision, 4. Repeat for a set time or number of repetitions.

name: Cone Drill
description: Speed and change-of-direction drills performed around cones to build agility.
instructions: 1. Lay the agility ladder on the ground, 2. Step quickly in and out of the squares in various patterns, 3. Focus on fast footwork and precision, 4. Repeat for a set time or number of repetitions.

name: Resistance Parachute Sprint
description: Sprinting while dragging a parachute to add resistance and improve sprint mechanics.
instructions: 1. Attach a parachute to your back and begin sprinting, 2. The parachute will create resistance, forcing you to work harder, 3. Sprint for a set distance or time, 4. Focus on maintaining speed despite the resistance.

name: Tire Flip
description: Flipping a heavy tire over repeatedly to build total body strength and power.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart in front of a large tire, 2. Squat down and grip the tire, 3. Using your legs and back, flip the tire over, 4. Continue flipping for a set number of reps or distance.

name: VersaClimber
description: A cardio machine that mimics a vertical climbing motion, working the full body.
instructions: 1. Adjust the VersaClimber for your height, 2. Begin climbing by pushing the pedals with your feet and pulling the handles with your arms, 3. Maintain a steady pace, 4. Focus on a full-body workout and increasing speed as you progress.

name: Human Flag
description: Holding the body horizontally while gripping a vertical pole.
instructions: 1. Grip a vertical pole with both hands, 2. Lift your legs and torso to a horizontal position, 3. Hold your body parallel to the ground, supported only by your arms.

name: Front Lever
description: Holding the body horizontally, face-up, while hanging from a bar.
instructions: 1. Hang from a pull-up bar, 2. Engage your core and pull your legs up in front of you, 3. Hold your body parallel to the ground, 4. Focus on maintaining a strong core and stability.

name: Back Lever
description: Holding the body horizontally, face-down, while hanging from a bar.
instructions: 1. Hang from a pull-up bar, 2. Engage your core and lift your legs behind you, 3. Slowly lower your body until it is parallel to the ground, 4. Hold the position and keep your body straight.

name: Hurdle Hop
description: Develops explosive leg power, agility, and coordination, engaging the quads, glutes, and calves.
instructions: 1. Set up small hurdles in a row, 2. Jump over each one with both feet, 3. Land softly and continue to next, 4. Maintain rhythm, 5. Repeat.

name: Cone Hops (Lateral)
description: Improves lateral agility, coordination, and lower body power, engaging the quads, glutes, and calves.
instructions: 1. Set cones in a line, 2. Stand to one side and hop laterally over each cone, 3. Land softly, 4. Continue hopping side to side, 5. Repeat.

name: Recumbent Bike
description: Low-impact cardio modality emphasizing the quads, hamstrings, and glutes with reduced spinal load.
instructions: 1. Sit on the Recumbent Bike and adjust the seat so knees are slightly bent, 2. Start pedaling slowly, 3. Increase resistance as needed, 4. Maintain an even pace, 5. Cool down to finish.

name: Plate Bicep Curl
description: Engages the biceps with a unique grip to increase forearm involvement and grip strength.
instructions: 1. Stand upright holding a plate, 2. Keep elbows tight to your sides, 3. Curl the plate up toward your chest, 4. Squeeze the biceps, 5. Lower slowly.

name: Plate Bicep Curl to Shoulder Press
description: A compound combo targeting biceps and delts, blending curl-to-press overhead movement.
instructions: 1. Stand upright holding a plate, 2. Keep elbows tight to your sides, 3. At the top, transition into a Shoulder Press, 4. Push the plate overhead, 5. Lower to chest then to start, 6. Repeat.

name: Rickshaw Carry
description: Builds traps, grip, and core endurance by walking with heavy loads at the sides, similar to farmerâ€™s carries.
instructions: 1. Pick up the handles, 2. Stand tall with a neutral spine, 3. Walk forward steadily, 4. Keep core braced, 5. Set down under control.

name: Rickshaw Deadlift
description: Mimics a trap bar deadlift to target the quads, glutes, and erector spinae with upright posture support.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell or handles in front, 2. Hinge at the hips and bend knees slightly to grip the bar, 3. Keep back straight and core tight, 4. Drive through your heels and extend hips and knees to lift the bar upright, 5. Lower the bar back down with control.

name: Ring Dip
description: Ring dips are a more challenging variation of dips that work your chest, triceps, and shoulders, while also engaging core and stabilizing muscles
instructions: 2. Grip the rings firmly and support your body with straight arms, 2. Lower your body by bending the elbows until shoulders dip below the rings, 3. Keep your core tight and body stable, 4. Press back up to the starting position with arms extended.

name: Plyometric Push Up
description: Explosive push-ups where hands leave the ground, increasing power and chest activation.
instructions: 1. Get into a push-up position, 2. Lower your body to the ground, 3. Push up explosively, lifting your hands off the ground, 4. Land softly and immediately lower your body again, 5. Repeat.

name: Box Jump
description: Jump onto a box to develop leg power and improve coordination and agility.
instructions: 1. Stand in front of a box or platform with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Bend your knees and lower into a squat, 3. Jump explosively onto the box, 4. Land softly and stand up straight, 5. Step back down and repeat.

name: Plyometric Lunge
description: Jumping lunges for explosive lower body strength and cardiovascular conditioning.
instructions: 1. Start in a lunge position, 2. Jump upward and switch your legs in the air, 3. Land softly in a lunge with the opposite leg forward, 4. Repeat, alternating legs with each jump.

name: Pull Up
description: Pull your body up to a bar using your upper back, arms, and core.
instructions: 1. Grab the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, 2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended, 3. Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar, 4. Slowly lower yourself back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Chin Up
description: Pull yourself up to a bar with palms facing you to work back and biceps.
instructions: 1. Grab the pull-up bar with an underhand grip, 2. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended, 3. Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar, 4. Slowly lower yourself back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Pull-Up (Neutral Grip)
description: A pull-up variation using parallel handles, emphasizing back and biceps.
instructions: 1. Grab the pull-up bar with your palms facing each other (neutral grip), 2. Hang with your arms fully extended, 3. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, 4. Lower yourself back down slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: Muscle Up
description: Pulling up over a bar and transitioning into a dip in one explosive movement.
instructions: 1. Begin hanging from a pull-up bar, 2. Perform a pull-up, then transition into a dip by pushing your chest above the bar, 3. Lower yourself back down and repeat.

name: L-Sit
description: Holding the body up on parallel bars with the legs extended straight out horizontally.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended, 2. Place your hands on the floor beside your hips, 3. Lift your legs and torso off the ground, keeping your body in an L-shape, 4. Hold the position.

name: Dragon Flag
description: A core-intensive movement lowering and raising the body while keeping it straight.
instructions: 1. Lie on a bench or the floor, holding onto a stable object behind your head, 2. Raise your body and legs straight up toward the ceiling, 3. Lower your body slowly while keeping your body rigid, 4. Return to the starting position.

name: Muscle Up (Kipping)
description: Combines a pull-up and dip, engaging the back, shoulders, chest, and triceps to build upper body pulling and pushing strength with momentum.
instructions: 1. Grab a pull-up bar with momentum, 2. Swing and pull up explosively, 3. Transition your chest over the bar, 4. Press to full lockout, 5. Lower back down.

name: Pull Up (Scapular)
description: A focused pull-up variation strengthening the lower traps, lats, and serratus anterior through scapular retraction only.
instructions: 1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, 2. Without bending your elbows, pull your shoulder blades down and together, 3. Hold briefly, then relax to the starting position.

name: Band Clam Shell
description: Target hip abductors and glutes by opening and closing the legs while lying on your side with a resistance band.
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with knees bent, feet stacked, 2. Place a band above your knees, 3. Open your top knee, keeping feet together, 4. Lower the knee back, repeat.

name: Band Side-Lying Leg Raise
description: Strengthen hips and outer thighs by lifting one leg against resistance while lying on your side.
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with a resistance band around ankles, 2. Keep bottom leg bent and top leg straight, 3. Lift top leg up, 4. Lower and repeat.

name: Band Side Leg Raise (Standing)
description: Perform side leg raises while standing, with a resistance band to target hips and glutes.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, 2. Place resistance band around ankles, 3. Lift one leg outward, 4. Lower and repeat.

name: Band Lateral Walk
description: Strengthen glutes and hip abductors by stepping sideways with a resistance band around the legs.
instructions: 1. Place band around thighs, 2. Get into squat position, 3. Take small side steps, 4. Walk a set distance, reverse direction.

name: Band Fire Hydrant
description: Perform fire hydrants with added resistance from a resistance band to target glutes and hips.
instructions: 1. Start in tabletop position, 2. Place band around thighs, 3. Bend knee to 90 degrees, 4. Raise leg out to the side, lower and repeat.

name: Band Bicep Curl
description: Resistance band curls for biceps, providing constant tension throughout the movement.
instructions: 1. Stand on a resistance band, holding the handles with palms facing upward, 2. Curl the handles toward your shoulders, 3. Slowly lower the handles back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Band Bicep Curl (Single Arm)
description: Single-arm bicep curls using a resistance band for targeted muscle engagement.
instructions: 1. Stand on a resistance band, holding one handle with your palm facing upward, 2. Curl the handle toward your shoulder, 3. Slowly lower the handle back down, 4. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Band Calf Raise
description: Resistance band calf raises to increase calf strength, providing constant tension throughout the movement.
instructions: 1. Stand on a resistance band with the handles in your hands, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, standing on the balls of your feet, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Band Chest Press
description: Resistance band chest press to target the pectorals with adjustable resistance throughout the movement.
instructions: 1. Stand with a resistance band behind your back, holding the handles in each hand, 2. Step forward to add tension to the band, 3. Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended, 4. Slowly return the handles to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Band Chest Fly
description: Chest fly exercise using resistance bands for controlled movement and chest muscle activation.
instructions: 1. Stand with a resistance band in each hand, 2. Extend your arms straight in front of you, 3. Slowly open your arms wide, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, 4. Bring your arms back together, 5. Repeat.

name: Band Monster Walk
description: Lateral band walks using a resistance band around the legs to target the glutes, hips, and outer thighs for hip mobility and strengthening.
instructions: 1. Place a resistance band around your legs just above your knees, 2. Lower into a slight squat position, 3. Step side-to-side, keeping tension on the band, 4. Repeat in both directions.

name: Band Rotation
description: A variation of the V-up where the legs and torso move toward one side to engage the obliques while working the core.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band to a fixed point, 2. Hold the band with both hands in front of you, 3. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 4. Rotate your torso to one side, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat on the other side.

name: Band Internal Rotation
description: Rotating the arm toward the body against band resistance to strengthen the rotator cuff muscles.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band to a fixed point at waist height, 2. Stand with your side to the band, 3. Hold the band handle with the hand closest to it, 4. Rotate your arm inward against the band's resistance, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Band External Rotation
description: Rotating the arm away from the body against band resistance to strengthen the rotator cuff and shoulder stability.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band to a fixed point at waist height, 2. Stand with your side to the band, 3. Hold the band handle with the hand closest to it, 4. Rotate your arm outward against the band's resistance, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Band Lateral Raise
description: Side arm raise using resistance bands to strengthen side shoulders.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold a resistance band with both hands, 3. Step on the middle of the band, 4. Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground, 5. Lower back down, 6. Repeat.

name: Band Front Raise
description: Front arm raise using bands to work the front shoulder muscles.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Hold a resistance band with both hands, 3. Step on the middle of the band, 4. Raise your arms straight in front of you until they are parallel to the ground, 5. Lower back down, 6. Repeat.

name: Band IYT
description: Band exercise moving arms into I, Y, and T shapes to strengthen shoulders.
instructions: 1. Hold a resistance band with both hands, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Raise your arms into an "I" position, then "Y," and finally into a "T" shape, 4. Lower back down and repeat the movement in each position.

name: Band Shrug
description: Resistance band shoulder shrug strengthening the upper traps.
instructions: 1. Stand on a resistance band with both hands gripping the handles, 2. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, 3. Lower your shoulders back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Band Reverse Fly
description: Pull a resistance band apart to strengthen the upper back and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band to a fixed point at chest height, 2. Grab the ends of the band with both hands, 3. Pull the band apart, keeping your arms slightly bent, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Band Row
description: Pull a resistance band toward your waist to build your upper back and arms.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band to a fixed point, 2. Grab the band with both hands, 3. Pull the band toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Band Pull Apart
description: An exercise where you stretch a resistance band horizontally to work the shoulders and upper back.
instructions: 1. Hold a resistance band with both hands in front of you, 2. Keep your arms slightly bent, 3. Pull the band apart by extending your arms outward, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Band Lat Pulldown
description: A resistance band version of the lat pulldown focusing on back strength.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band overhead, 2. Grab the band with both hands, 3. Pull the band down toward your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Banded Dorsiflesion Stretch
description: Using a band to improve ankle mobility by stretching into dorsiflexion.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band to a stationary object and place it around your foot, 2. Step back to create tension in the band, 3. Flex your ankle and push it forward, 4. Hold the stretch and repeat.

name: Band Assisted Pull Up
description: Builds back and bicep strength while assisting beginners in proper pull-up form.
instructions: 1. Loop a resistance band over the pull-up bar and place your foot or knee in it, 2. Grip the bar with both hands, 3. Pull your chin over the bar, 4. Lower down slowly and repeat.

name: Band Good Morning
description: A hip hinge movement that targets hamstrings, glutes, and lower back with resistance band tension.
instructions: 1. Stand on a resistance band and loop it over your shoulders, 2. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend, 3. Keep your back flat and return to standing, 4. Repeat the motion.

name: Band Skull Crusher
description: Isolates the triceps using resistance bands to improve elbow extension strength.
instructions: 1. Anchor a band behind you and lie on a bench, 2. Hold the band handles and extend arms above your head, 3. Bend your elbows to lower the bands beside your head, 4. Extend back up.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl (Cross Body)
description: Emphasizes the outer head and brachialis muscles of the biceps to enhance arm thickness and definition.
instructions: 1. Hold dumbbells at your sides, 2. Curl one dumbbell across your body toward the opposite shoulder, 3. Squeeze the biceps at the top, 4. Lower back down and alternate arms, 5. Repeat.

name: Band Deadlift
description: Engages the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back to build hip hinge strength and power with accommodating resistance.
instructions: 1. Stand on a resistance band with feet hip-width apart, 2. Grab the band handles or ends, 3. Stand up by driving through your heels and extending your hips, 4. Squeeze glutes at the top, 5. Lower back down and repeat.

name: Barbell Deadlift (With Bands)
description: Strengthens the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back while the bands increase resistance at the top for greater lockout power.
instructions: 1. Anchor resistance bands to the floor and attach to a barbell, 2. Stand with feet hip-width apart, 3. Grip the bar and lift by extending your hips and knees, 4. Stand tall and lock out at the top, 5. Lower the bar under control.

name: Band Rack Pull
description: Adds resistance curve to glutes, hamstrings, and traps training while enhancing lockout strength via bands.
instructions: 1. Set a resistance band under your feet for Band Rack Pulls, 2. Hold the ends with a firm grip and hinge at the hips, 3. Pull upward until your torso is erect, 4. Control the descent back to start, 5. Repeat.

name: Sled Drag (Backward)
description: Works the quads, glutes, and calves while improving knee joint health and sprint mechanics.
instructions: 1. Attach a sled harness or grab the handles, 2. Face away and walk backward while dragging the sled, 3. Keep low and take small, powerful steps, 4. Maintain a strong core.

name: Bear Crawl
description: Engages the core, shoulders, and hips for coordination, endurance, and full-body mobility.
instructions: 1. Start on all fours with knees off the ground, 2. Crawl forward with opposite hand and foot, 3. Keep core tight and hips low, 4. Move continuously.

name: Bear Crawl Sled Drag
description: Combines crawling with resistance to develop core strength, shoulder stability, and conditioning.
instructions: 1. Get into bear crawl position with sled attached, 2. Crawl forward pulling the sled behind you, 3. Maintain good form, 4. Continue for distance or time.

name: Smith Machine Calf Raise
alias_1: Standing Calf Raises on Smith Machine
description: Calf raises using the Smith machine for added stability and resistance during the movement.
instructions: 1. Position yourself under the Smith machine bar with your shoulders aligned, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, standing on the balls of your feet, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
description: Bench press using the Smith machine for guided, controlled movements targeting the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on the bench with the Smith machine bar at chest height, 2. Grab the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, 3. Lower the barbell to your chest, 4. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press (Incline)
description: Inclined bench press using the Smith machine for a controlled motion targeting the upper chest.
