instructions: 1. Set the bench to an incline position under the Smith machine, 2. Lie back and grab the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, 3. Lower the barbell to your upper chest, 4. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Squat
description: Squats using a Smith machine for guided movement and focused engagement of the legs and glutes.
instructions: 1. Set the barbell on the Smith machine at shoulder height, 2. Position your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees, 4. Push through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Shoudler Press
description: Overhead shoulder press using the guided Smith machine bar.
instructions: 1. Set the bar on the Smith machine to shoulder height, 2. Sit down with your back supported, 3. Grip the bar with your palms facing forward, 4. Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, 5. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder height, 6. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Inverted Row
description: Inverted row using the bar on a Smith machine to strengthen the back.
instructions: 1. Set the Smith machine bar at waist height, 2. Lie underneath the bar, holding it with an overhand grip, 3. Keep your body in a straight line, 4. Pull your chest toward the bar, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 5. Lower yourself back down slowly, 6. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press (Decline)
description: Works the lower chest (sternal head of pectorals) with added stability to focus on muscle engagement for strength and hypertrophy.
instructions: 1. Set a decline bench under the Smith machine, 2. Unrack the bar and lower it to your lower chest, 3. Press the bar back up, 4. Keep elbows at about 45 degrees, 5. Repeat.

name: Smith Machine Split Squat
description: Targets the quads and glutes with stabilized unilateral loading for balance and lower-body strength.
instructions: 1. Position one foot forward and the other back under the Smith machine bar, 2. Lower your body by bending both knees until the back knee nearly touches the floor, 3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged, 4. Push through the front heel to return to standing.

name: Smith Machine Hip Thrust
description: Glute-dominant movement enhancing hip extension, supported by hamstrings and core, using bar path stability.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench and the barbell resting on your hips, 2. Plant your feet flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart, 3. Drive your hips upward until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, 4. Lower hips back down under control.

name: Stabiliity Ball Pike
description: In a plank position with feet on a stability ball, bring your hips upward into a pike position.
instructions: 1. Start in push-up position with feet on stability ball, 2. Raise hips toward ceiling, 3. Roll ball toward hands, 4. Lower back and repeat.

name: Stability Ball Crunche
description: Sit on a stability ball, roll down to your lower back, and perform crunches to target the abs.
instructions: 1. Sit on a stability ball with feet flat, 2. Roll down so back is supported, 3. Crunch torso upward, 4. Lower and repeat.

name: Stability Ball Leg Curl
description: Hamstring curl using a stability ball by pulling your legs toward your body while lying on your back.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with your feet on a stability ball, 2. Lift your hips off the ground, 3. Curl the ball toward your glutes by bending your knees, 4. Slowly release the ball back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Stability Ball Leg Curl (Single Leg)
description: Single-leg variation of stability ball leg curls to isolate each hamstring and improve strength balance.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with one foot on a stability ball, 2. Lift your hips off the ground, 3. Curl the ball toward your glutes with one leg, 4. Slowly release the ball back to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other leg.

name: T-Bar Row
description: Pull a T-bar attachment toward your body while bent over to build back and arms.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 2. Place a barbell into a T-Bar row machine or landmine attachment, 3. Bend at the hips and knees slightly to grab the handles, 4. Row the handles towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 5. Slowly return to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Trap Bar Farmer's Walk
description: Carrying a trap bar loaded with weight while walking to enhance grip, core, and full-body strength.
instructions: 1. Stand in the trap bar and grip the handles, 2. Stand tall with your chest up, 3. Walk forward while keeping your core engaged, 4. Walk for a set distance or time, 5. Repeat.

name: Trap Bar Deadlift
description: Deadlift using a trap bar to reduce stress on the lower back while still targeting the legs, glutes, and back.
instructions: 1. Stand in the trap bar, 2. Grip the handles, 3. Lift the bar by driving through your heels, 4. Lower the bar back to the ground, 5. Repeat.

name: Trap Bar Shrug
description: Shrugging movement using a trap bar to work upper back muscles.
instructions: 1. Stand in a trap bar with both hands gripping the handles, 2. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, 3. Lower your shoulders back down, 4. Repeat.

name: TRX Abs Rollout
description: Use a TRX suspension trainer to roll forward and back, activating the core and stabilizing muscles.
instructions: 1. Set TRX straps at knee height, 2. Kneel with feet under straps, 3. Roll body forward, 4. Pull back to start.

name: TRX Pike
description: Perform pikes using TRX straps, lifting your hips toward the ceiling while maintaining a plank position.
instructions: 1. Start in plank with feet in TRX straps, 2. Raise hips toward ceiling, 3. Lower back to start, 4. Repeat.

name: TRX Bicep Curl
description: Perform bicep curls using TRX straps, engaging the core and biceps simultaneously.
instructions: 1. Hold the TRX handles with palms facing upward, 2. Lean back and extend your arms, 3. Curl your hands toward your shoulders, 4. Lower back down slowly, 5. Repeat.

name: TRX Bicep Curl (Single Arm)
description: Isolate each arm with single-arm TRX bicep curls, engaging both the core and biceps.
instructions: 1. Hold one TRX handle with your palm facing upward, 2. Lean back and extend your arm, 3. Curl the handle toward your shoulder, 4. Lower back down slowly, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: TRX Calf Raise
description: Calf raises with TRX straps, engaging the core while strengthening the calves.
instructions: 1. Hold the TRX handles with your arms extended, 2. Raise your heels off the ground, standing on the balls of your feet, 3. Lower your heels back down slowly, 4. Repeat.

name: TRX Chest Fly
description: Chest fly using TRX straps to engage the core and chest muscles in a functional movement.
instructions: 1. Hold the TRX handles with your palms facing each other, 2. Lean back and extend your arms in front of you, 3. Open your arms wide, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, 4. Bring your arms back together, 5. Repeat.

name: TRX Squat Jump
description: Squat jumps using TRX straps for added stability while enhancing explosive strength in the legs.
instructions: 1. Hold the TRX handles and lower your body into a squat position, 2. Jump explosively upward while keeping tension on the TRX straps, 3. Land softly and immediately lower back into a squat, 4. Repeat.

name: TRX Squat
description: Squats using TRX straps to improve form and stability while focusing on quads, hamstrings, and glutes.
instructions: 1. Hold the TRX handles with your arms extended, 2. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees, 3. Keep your chest up and back straight, 4. Push through your heels to return to standing, 5. Repeat.

name: TRX Split Squat
description: Split squats using TRX straps for stability, helping to develop lower body strength and balance with minimal equipment.
instructions: 1. Hold the TRX handles, 2. Position one leg behind you, 3. Lower your body by bending your front knee, 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: TRX Reverse Fly
description: TRX movement pulling arms apart to target upper back and rear shoulders.
instructions: 1. Set the TRX straps to a medium length, 2. Stand facing the anchor point, leaning back with your arms extended in front of you, 3. Open your arms wide, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: TRX IYT
description: TRX bodyweight moves raising arms into I, Y, and T shapes for shoulder strength.
instructions: 1. Set the TRX straps to a medium length, 2. Stand facing the anchor point, lean back with your arms extended, 3. Raise your arms to form an "I" shape, then "Y" and "T," 4. Lower your arms and repeat each movement.

name: TRX Face Pull
description: TRX pulling exercise targeting rear delts and upper back muscles.
instructions: 1. Set the TRX straps to a medium length, 2. Stand facing the anchor point, holding the straps with your arms extended, 3. Pull the straps towards your face, keeping your elbows high and wide, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: TRX Row
description: Use TRX straps to pull your chest toward your hands for back and bicep strength.
instructions: 1. Set the TRX straps at an appropriate length, 2. Grab the handles and lean back with your arms extended, 3. Pull your chest towards the handles, squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Flutter Kick
description: Alternate kicking your legs up and down while lying on your back to engage the core and lower abs.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with legs straight, 2. Lift legs slightly off the floor, 3. Alternate kicking legs up and down, 4. Repeat.

name: Crossbody Mountain Climber
description: Bring one knee across your body toward the opposite elbow while in a push-up position.
instructions: 1. Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders, 2. Drive your right knee toward your left elbow, 3. Return the leg and alternate with the left knee toward the right elbow, 4. Continue alternating legs quickly.

name: Seated In & Out
description: Sit with legs bent and feet off the ground, extend and bring them back in to engage the core.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, 2. Lean back slightly, 3. Extend legs out while keeping your balance, 4. Pull legs back in, bringing knees toward chest, 5. Repeat.

name: Side Plank
description: Hold a plank position on your side with one arm supporting your body, targeting the obliques.
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with legs extended and feet stacked, 2. Prop yourself up on your forearm, 3. Lift hips to form a straight line from head to feet, 4. Hold the position, keeping hips lifted.

name: Bird Dog
description: From a tabletop position, extend one arm and opposite leg while maintaining balance to strengthen the core.
instructions: 1. Start in tabletop position (hands and knees), 2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg backward, 3. Return to starting position, 4. Alternate sides.

name: Plank Shoulder Tap
description: In a plank position, tap each shoulder with the opposite hand while maintaining core stability.
instructions: 1. Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders, 2. Engage core and tap your right shoulder with your left hand, 3. Return the left hand to the ground, 4. Tap your left shoulder with your right hand, 5. Continue alternating.

name: Plank Jack
description: Perform jumping jacks in a plank position, engaging the core while alternating foot movements.
instructions: 1. Start in a high plank position, 2. Jump your feet out to the sides, 3. Jump your feet back together, 4. Continue alternating quickly like a jumping jack motion.

name: Plank to Push-Up
description: Transition from a forearm plank to a full push-up position, engaging the core throughout.
instructions: 1. Start in a forearm plank position, 2. Push up onto your right hand, then left, 3. Lower back down onto your right forearm, then left, 4. Continue alternating between forearm plank and push-up position.

name: Hollow Body Hold
description: Lie on your back, lift your legs and shoulders off the ground, forming a hollow shape with the body.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with arms extended overhead, 2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs off the floor while keeping your lower back pressed into the ground, 3. Hold the position, maintaining a flat back.

name: Weighted Sit-Up
description: Perform sit-ups while holding a weight plate or dumbbell to increase core resistance.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and holding a weight plate or dumbbell at chest level, 2. Perform a traditional sit-up, bringing your chest toward your knees, 3. Lower back down slowly and repeat.

name: Weighted Russian Twist
description: Sit on the floor, twist your torso side to side while holding a weight to target the obliques.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, 2. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell with both hands, 3. Lean back slightly and twist your torso to the right, then to the left, 4. Continue alternating sides while keeping your core engaged.

name: Kettlebell Windmill
description: Hold a kettlebell overhead and rotate your torso while lowering your body to the side, targeting the obliques.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet wide and a kettlebell in one hand overhead, 2. Keeping the kettlebell overhead, bend at the hips to lower your torso while looking at the kettlebell, 3. Push back up to standing position.

name: Dumbbell Dead Bug
description: Lie on your back and alternate extending opposite arms and legs while holding dumbbells to engage the core.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with a dumbbell in each hand and knees bent at 90 degrees, 2. Extend your right arm and left leg out straight, 3. Return to start and repeat on the other side.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Sit-Up
description: Perform sit-ups while holding a dumbbell overhead to challenge the abs and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Lie on your back with a dumbbell held overhead, 2. Perform a sit-up, bringing your torso up while keeping the dumbbell overhead, 3. Lower back down slowly and repeat.

name: Stability Ball Stir-the-Pot
description: In a plank position with forearms on a stability ball, move your arms in small circles.
instructions: 1. Start in a forearm plank position with your forearms on a stability ball, 2. Rotate your arms in small circular motions while keeping your core tight, 3. Continue for the desired time, making the circle bigger over time.

name: TRX Mountain Climber
description: In a TRX suspended plank position, alternate bringing knees to your chest in a climbing motion.
instructions: 1. Start in a plank position with feet in TRX straps, 2. Bring one knee toward your chest, 3. Quickly switch legs in a running motion, 4. Continue alternating knees.

name: TRX Knee Tuck
description: Use TRX straps to pull your knees toward your chest while holding a suspended plank position.
instructions: 1. Start in a plank position with feet in TRX straps, 2. Bring your knees toward your chest, 3. Extend your legs back out to plank position, 4. Repeat.

name: Stability Ball Knee Tuck
description: Perform knee tucks by pulling your knees towards your chest while in a plank position on a ball.
instructions: 1. Start in a plank position with your shins on a stability ball, 2. Roll the ball toward your chest by bending your knees, 3. Roll the ball back out, returning to plank position, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Zottman Curl
description: Perform a bicep curl, then rotate the wrists and lower the weight in a reverse curl motion.
instructions: 1. Stand with dumbbells in both hands, palms facing up, 2. Curl the dumbbells to your shoulders, 3. At the top, rotate wrists so palms face down, 4. Lower the dumbbells with palms facing down, 5. Rotate wrists back and repeat.

name: Cable Bayesian Curl
alias_2: Cable Bicep Curls with Bayesian Grip
description: Perform bicep curls with a cable machine, focusing on slow and controlled movement for muscle activation.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to a low pulley, 2. Grab the cable attachment with both hands, 3. Curl the cable toward your shoulders, 4. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Waiter Curl
description: Hold a dumbbell with both hands overhead and curl it toward your face, focusing on the shoulders and arms.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height with your elbow bent, 2. Curl the dumbbell upward toward your shoulder, 3. Lower back down slowly, 4. Repeat on the other side.

name: Barbell Bench Press (Close Grip)
description: Barbell bench press with a narrow grip, emphasizing the triceps and inner chest.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on the bench, gripping the barbell with your hands closer than shoulder-width, 2. Lower the barbell to your chest, 3. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Bench Press (Paused)
description: Paused bench press where you hold at the bottom to increase muscle tension and strength.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on the bench, 2. Lower the barbell to your chest and pause for 1â€“3 seconds, 3. Push the barbell back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Bench Press (Tempo)
description: Bench press focusing on controlled movement speed for increased time under tension and muscle growth.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on the bench and grip the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, 2. Lower the barbell slowly for a set count (e.g., 3-5 seconds), 3. Pause at the bottom for 1 second, 4. Press the barbell back up explosively, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Bench Press (Reverse Grip)
description: Bench press with an underhand grip to target the upper chest and reduce shoulder strain.
instructions: 1. Lie flat on the bench and grip the barbell with an underhand (reverse) grip, 2. Lower the barbell to your chest, 3. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Push Up (Archer)
description: Wide push-up variation where one arm extends fully, increasing chest and shoulder activation.
instructions: 1. Get into a push-up position, 2. Lower your body toward one hand, extending the other arm out to the side, 3. Push yourself back up, 4. Repeat on the other side.

name: TRX Push Up
description: Push-up using TRX straps to engage the chest, shoulders, and core with added instability.
instructions: 1. Set the TRX straps so your body is angled, 2. Place your hands on the straps, 3. Lower your body to the ground by bending your elbows, 4. Push your body back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Incline Fly
description: Inclined chest fly using cables, isolating the upper chest for a full stretch and contraction.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to a low position, 2. Grab the handles and step forward, 3. With a slight bend in your elbows, bring your arms upward and together, 4. Slowly return your arms back to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Low to High Fly
description: Chest fly using cables from low to high, targeting the upper chest and shoulders.
instructions: 1. Set the cables at a low position, 2. Grab the handles, 3. With a slight bend in your elbows, bring your arms upward and in front of your face, 4. Slowly return your arms to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Machine Fly with Pause Hold
description: Chest fly using a machine, pausing at the peak to increase time under tension.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your arms extended, 2. Squeeze the handles together and hold for a moment at the peak contraction, 3. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Diamond Push Up
description: Push-up variation with hands close together forming a diamond shape, focusing on the triceps and inner chest.
instructions: 1. Get into a push-up position with your hands placed close together under your chest, forming a diamond shape with your fingers, 2. Lower your body to the ground, 3. Push your body back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Dead Hang
description: Hanging from a bar to increase grip strength, shoulder mobility, and forearm endurance.
instructions: 1. Grab a pull-up bar with both hands, 2. Let your body hang down with your arms fully extended, 3. Keep your shoulders engaged and core tight, 4. Hold for a set amount of time, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Deadlift (Sumo)
description: A sumo stance deadlift using a wider stance and a barbell to focus on the glutes, quads, and inner thighs.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width, 2. Grip the barbell with your hands inside your knees, 3. Lift the barbell by driving through your heels, 4. Lower the barbell back to the ground, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Deadlift (Conventional)
description: Traditional barbell deadlift, lifting from the ground to target the posterior chain, including hamstrings and lower back.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, 2. Grip the barbell with your hands outside your knees, 3. Lift the barbell by driving through your heels, 4. Lower the barbell back to the ground, 5. Repeat.

name: Cable Pull-Through
description: A cable machine exercise to target the glutes and hamstrings by pulling a rope attachment through the legs.
instructions: 1. Attach a rope to the low pulley of a cable machine, 2. Stand facing away from the machine with the rope between your legs, 3. Hinge at your hips and pull the rope through, 4. Stand up straight, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Box Squat
description: Box squats with a barbell to help develop proper squat depth and power by sitting back onto a box before standing up.
instructions: 1. Set a box or bench behind you, 2. Place a barbell across your upper back, 3. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 4. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, 5. Sit back onto the box, then drive through your heels to stand back up, 6. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Box Squat
description: Bodyweight squats using a box for proper depth and controlled movement, focusing on leg and glute engagement.
instructions: 1. Set a box or bench behind you, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, 4. Sit back onto the box, then stand back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Walking Lunge
description: Lunges performed while walking forward to target the quads, glutes, and hamstrings with each step.
instructions: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, 2. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are at 90-degree angles, 3. Push through the front heel to stand back up and bring the other leg forward, 4. Repeat alternating legs.

name: Bodyweight Pistol Squat
description: Single-leg squats performed with the other leg extended in front, focusing on balance, strength, and mobility in each leg.
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg and extend the other leg straight in front of you, 2. Lower your body by bending the standing knee, 3. Keep your extended leg off the ground, 4. Push through your heel to return to standing, 5. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Barbell Squat (Paused)
description: A squat where you pause briefly at the bottom of the movement to increase time under tension and build strength in the lower body.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell on your upper back, 2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees, 4. Pause at the bottom for a brief moment, 5. Push through your heels to return to standing, 6. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Squat (Paused)
description: A paused squat with dumbbells held at the sides, adding resistance while increasing time under tension for greater muscle activation.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body by bending your knees, 4. Pause at the bottom for a brief moment, 5. Drive through your heels to return to standing, 6. Repeat.

name: Machine Hack Squat (Paused)
description: Paused hack squats on the machine, emphasizing control and strength at the bottom of the squat movement.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform, 2. Lower your body by bending your knees, 3. Pause at the bottom for a moment, 4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Barbell Front Squat (Paused)
description: Paused front squats to target the quads and core, increasing muscle engagement and stability at the bottom of the squat.
instructions: 1. Place a barbell across the front of your shoulders, 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Lower your body into a squat, 4. Pause at the bottom for a brief moment, 5. Push through your heels to return to standing, 6. Repeat.

name: Oblique V-Up
description: Using a medicine ball to mimic a woodchopper movement, rotating the torso while lowering the ball diagonally to engage the obliques and core.
instructions: 1. Lie on your side with your legs straight and stacked, 2. Place your top hand behind your head, 3. Lift your legs and upper body off the ground, bringing your elbow towards your hip, 4. Return to the starting position, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Medicine Ball Woodchopper
description: A cable exercise where the user stands perpendicular to the cable machine and presses the handle straight out in front to work the core, particularly the obliques.
instructions: 1. Hold a medicine ball with both hands, 2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Twist your torso and bring the medicine ball diagonally from one side to the other, 4. Rotate through your hips and core, 5. Repeat on the other side.

name: Cable Pallof Press
description: Core stability exercise pressing a cable handle straight out from the chest while resisting rotation.
instructions: 1. Attach cable handle at a belly-button height, 2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Hold the cable handle with both hands in front of you, 4. Press the cable outwards, resisting rotation, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Band Pallof Press
description: Same as the Cable Pallof Press, but using a resistance band to create tension and resist rotation.
instructions: 1. Attach a resistance band, 2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, 3. Hold the band handle with both hands in front of you, 4. Press the band outwards, resisting rotation, 5. Return to the starting position, 6. Repeat.

name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist (Seated)
description: Seated on the ground holding a medicine ball, rotating the torso side to side to engage the obliques and core.
instructions: 1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, 2. Hold a medicine ball with both hands, 3. Lean back slightly and twist your torso from side to side, 4. Touch the ball to the ground next to your hip on each side, 5. Repeat.

name: Prone Y Raise
description: Lying face down and lifting the arms into a â€œYâ€ position to strengthen the upper traps, rhomboids, and rotator cuff muscles.
instructions: 1. Lie face down on an incline bench, 2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, 3. Raise your arms in a Y shape above your head, 4. Lower back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise (Incline)
description: Lying on an incline bench while lifting dumbbells sideways for shoulders.
instructions: 1. Lie on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground, 3. Lower back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Front Raise
description: Barbell lift forward strengthening front shoulder muscles.
instructions: 1. Hold a barbell with both hands in front of you, 2. Raise the barbell straight in front of you until your arms are parallel to the ground, 3. Lower the barbell back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press (Neutral Grip)
alias_2: DB Shoulder Press with Neutral Grip
description: Overhead dumbbell press with palms facing each other.
instructions: 1. Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other, 2. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, 3. Lower the dumbbells back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Push Press
description: Barbell overhead press using a small leg drive for extra power.
instructions: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell at shoulder height, 2. Bend your knees slightly and then explosively press the barbell overhead, 3. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder height, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Upright Row
description: Pulling a barbell up toward the chest to target shoulders and traps.
instructions: 1. Hold a barbell in front of you with both hands, 2. Pull the barbell straight up towards your chin, keeping your elbows higher than your hands, 3. Lower the barbell back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Upright Row
description: Lifting dumbbells up close to the body for shoulder and trap strength.
instructions: 1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of you, 2. Pull the dumbbells straight up towards your chin, keeping your elbows higher than your hands, 3. Lower the dumbbells back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Cable Shrug
description: Shrugging shoulders upward using a cable machine for constant tension.
instructions: 1. Set the cable machine to the lowest setting with the handle attached, 2. Stand with the handle in each hand, 3. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, 4. Lower your shoulders back down, 5. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Shrug (Incline)
description: Shrugging with dumbbells while lying on an incline bench.
instructions: 1. Lie on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, 2. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, 3. Lower your shoulders back down, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Press (Overhead)
description: Press dumbbells overhead to extend and strengthen the triceps.
instructions: 1. Sit or stand with a dumbbell in both hands above your head, elbows bent, 2. Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Barbell Tricep Press (Overhead)
description: Lift and lower a barbell overhead to work the triceps.
instructions: 1. Stand with a barbell in both hands, held overhead, elbows bent, 2. Lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Bench Tricep Dip
description: Lower yourself off a bench and press back up to strengthen triceps and chest.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with your hands beside your hips, 2. Place your feet flat on the floor or extend them out in front of you, 3. Lower your body by bending your elbows to 90 degrees, 4. Push back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Bench Tricep Dip (Weighted)
description: Same as bench dips but with added weight for more resistance.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with your hands beside your hips, 2. Place a weight on your lap or use a dip belt, 3. Lower your body by bending your elbows, 4. Push back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Tricep Dip (Weighted)
description: Standard dip exercise wearing extra weight to challenge triceps and chest.
instructions: 1. Place a weight on your lap or use a dip belt, 2. Lower your body by bending your elbows to 90 degrees, 3. Push back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Press (Seated)
description: Seated overhead tricep press using a dumbbell or bar for control and strength.
instructions: 1. Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in both hands, palms facing each other, 2. Press the dumbbell overhead, extending your arms, 3. Lower the dumbbell back down behind your head by bending your elbows, 4. Extend your arms back up, 5. Repeat.

name: Band Tricep Pushdown
description: Push a resistance band downward to work the triceps.
instructions: 1. Set up a resistance band overhead, 2. Grab the band with both hands, palms facing down, 3. Pull the band downward, extending your arms fully, 4. Slowly return to the starting position, 5. Repeat.

name: Kettlebell Tricep Extension
description: Extend a kettlebell overhead to strengthen the triceps.
instructions: 1. Hold a kettlebell with both hands overhead, elbows bent, 2. Lower the kettlebell behind your head by bending your elbows, 3. Extend your arms back up, 4. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell Jumping Lunge
description: Explosive lunges done while holding weights to increase intensity.
instructions: 1. Start in a lunge position holding weights, 2. Jump and switch legs in the air, 3. Land softly into a lunge with the opposite leg forward, 4. Repeat.

name: Depth Jump
description: Stepping off a box and jumping immediately upon landing to build reactive strength.
instructions: 1. Stand on a raised surface (like a box or platform), 2. Step off and drop to the ground, 3. Upon landing, immediately explode upward into a jump, 4. Focus on minimal ground contact time.

name: Plyo Step-Up
description: Explosive step-ups onto a box or platform, focusing on power and speed.
instructions: 1. Stand in front of a bench or platform, 2. Step up onto the platform with one leg, 3. Explode upward and bring your other knee to your chest, 4. Step back down and repeat, alternating legs.

name: Push Up (Single Arm)
description: Performing a push-up with just one arm for extreme upper body strength.
instructions: 1. Start in a push-up position, 2. Place one hand on the floor, 3. Lower your body to the ground, keeping your body straight, 4. Push back up to the starting position, 5. Repeat with the other arm.

name: Handstand Push-Up
description: A push-up variation done while upside down against a wall or freestanding.
instructions: 1. Kick up into a handstand against a wall, 2. Lower your body by bending your elbows, 3. Push back up to the handstand position, 4. Repeat the movement.

name: Planche Push-Up
description: Push-ups performed while balancing the body parallel to the ground without feet touching.
instructions: 1. Start in a planche position with your hands on the ground and your body parallel to the floor, 2. Lower your body by bending your elbows, 3. Push back up to the starting position, 4. Repeat the movement.

name: Axle Deadlift
description: Targets the posterior chain while emphasizing grip strength due to the thick bar diameter.
instructions: 1. Set up with feet hip-width and grip the axle bar, 2. Keep your back straight and chest up, 3. Drive through your heels to lift the bar, 4. Lock out at the top and return with control.

name: Machine Chest Press (Cybex)
description: A pressing exercise that targets the chest muscles using a Cybex machine for upper body strength development.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles are at mid-chest level, 2. Sit back with feet flat and grip the handles with a neutral wrist, 3. Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended but not locked, 4. Control the weight as you return to the starting position, maintaining tension in your chest.

name: Machine Incline Chest Press (Cybex)
description: A pressing exercise that emphasizes the upper chest using an incline Cybex machine for upper pectoral development.
instructions: 1. Set the seat height so the handles align with your upper chest, 2. Grip the handles and press upward in a diagonal path, 3. Extend your arms without locking your elbows, 4. Lower the handles with control to stretch the upper chest before repeating.

name: Machine Shoulder Press (Cybex)
description: A pressing exercise that targets the deltoid muscles using a seated Cybex machine for shoulder strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles start just below shoulder height, 2. Sit upright with your back against the pad and grip the handles, 3. Press the handles directly overhead, keeping your elbows slightly in front of your body, 4. Lower slowly until your elbows are just below 90 degrees.

name: Machine Seated Row (Cybex)
description: A pulling exercise that targets the upper back using a Cybex seated row machine for posture and back strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the chest pad and seat so the handles are at chest height, 2. Grasp the handles with a neutral grip and brace your core, 3. Pull the handles toward your torso while squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Pause briefly, then slowly extend your arms to the starting position.

name: Machine Leg Press (Cybex)
description: A compound lower body exercise that targets the quads, glutes, and hamstrings using a Cybex leg press for overall leg strength.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back flat against the pad and place feet shoulder-width on the platform, 2. Unlock the sled and lower it by bending your knees to 90 degrees, 3. Drive through your heels to press the weight upward, 4. Avoid locking your knees at the top and repeat with control.

name: Plate Loaded Leg Press (Cybex)
description: A compound exercise for the quads and glutes using a plate-loaded Cybex leg press for powerful lower body training.
instructions: 1. Position yourself with feet flat on the platform and shoulders under the pads, 2. Release the safety handles and lower the sled by bending your knees, 3. Press through your heels to drive the weight back up, 4. Keep your back and hips against the pad throughout the movement.

name: Machine Leg Extension (Cybex)
description: An isolation exercise that targets the quadriceps using a Cybex machine for knee extension strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the back pad and roller so it sits above your ankles, 2. Sit upright and grip the handles for support, 3. Extend your knees to lift the pad while contracting your quads, 4. Pause briefly at the top, then lower with control.

name: Machine Seated Leg Curl (Cybex)
description: A leg curl exercise that targets the hamstrings using a Cybex seated machine for posterior thigh strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the pad so it rests above your heels and secure the thigh pad, 2. Sit upright and grip the handles, 3. Curl your legs downward by bending your knees, 4. Squeeze your hamstrings, then slowly return to the start.

name: Machine Lying Leg Curl (Cybex)
description: A prone hamstring isolation exercise using a Cybex machine to strengthen the back of the thighs.
instructions: 1. Position yourself face down on the machine with the pad resting just above your ankles and your hips aligned with the pivot point. 2. Grip the handles and keep your hips pressed firmly against the bench throughout the movement. 3. Curl your heels toward your glutes by contracting your hamstrings, avoiding any hip lifting. 4. Squeeze your hamstrings at the top of the movement for a brief pause. 5. Lower the weight slowly and with control, stopping just short of full leg extension to maintain tension.

name: Machine Seated Calf Raises (Cybex)
description: A calf isolation exercise that targets the soleus using a Cybex machine for improved lower leg endurance.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine with the balls of your feet on the platform and your knees positioned under the pads. 2. Adjust the knee pads so they rest comfortably on your thighs just above your knees. 3. Lower your heels as far as possible to achieve a deep stretch in your calves. 4. Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible, contracting your calf muscles. 5. Hold the peak contraction briefly before slowly lowering back to the stretched position with control.

name: Machine Hip Abduction (Cybex)
description: A hip isolation exercise that targets the gluteus medius using a seated Cybex machine for lateral hip strength.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back against the pad and place your legs against the thigh pads, 2. Adjust the range of motion to a comfortable stretch, 3. Push your legs outward against the pads, 4. Squeeze at the end range and return slowly.

name: Machine Hip Adduction (Cybex)
description: A hip isolation exercise that targets the adductor muscles using a Cybex machine for inner thigh stability.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back against the pad and legs spread on the outer pads, 2. Adjust the range of motion if needed, 3. Bring your legs together by squeezing your inner thighs, 4. Pause at the peak and return with control.

name: Machine Preacher Curl (Cybex)
description: An arm isolation exercise that targets the biceps using a Cybex preacher curl machine for arm hypertrophy.
instructions: 1. Sit and place your upper arms on the angled pad with hands gripping the handles, 2. Curl the handles toward your shoulders, 3. Squeeze your biceps at the top, 4. Lower the handles slowly to the starting position.

name: Machine Tricep Extension (Cybex)
description: An isolation exercise that targets the triceps using a Cybex machine for pushing strength and arm tone.
instructions: 1. Sit upright with elbows aligned with the pivot point, 2. Grip the handles with palms facing down, 3. Extend your arms downward fully, 4. Pause briefly and return with control.

name: Machine Chest Fly (Cybex)
description: A chest isolation exercise that targets the pectorals using a Cybex machine for inner chest activation.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back flat and arms extended to the sides gripping the handles, 2. Bring the handles together in front of your chest, 3. Squeeze your chest at the midpoint, 4. Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Machine Rear Delt (Cybex)
description: A pulling exercise that targets the rear deltoids using a reverse fly motion on a Cybex machine for posterior shoulder strength.
instructions: 1. Sit facing the pad and grip the handles with arms extended in front, 2. Pull the handles outward and back in a wide arc, 3. Focus on squeezing the rear delts at full contraction, 4. Return with control.

name: Machine Pullover (Cybex)
description: A lat-focused isolation exercise using a Cybex pullover machine for back and chest expansion.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back against the pad and arms overhead holding the handles, 2. Pull the handles down in an arc toward your hips, 3. Engage your lats through the motion, 4. Return to the top without relaxing tension.

name: Machine Rotary Torso (Cybex)
description: A rotational exercise that targets the obliques using a Cybex machine for trunk rotation and core stability.
instructions: 1. Sit with your chest against the pad and grip the handles, 2. Rotate your torso against resistance toward one side, 3. Engage your obliques through the motion, 4. Slowly return and repeat on the other side.

name: Machine Back Extension (Cybex)
description: A spinal extension exercise that targets the lower back using a Cybex machine for lumbar strength.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back against the pad and feet secured, 2. Cross your arms or grip the handles, 3. Extend your back against the resistance while keeping your spine neutral, 4. Pause at the top and return slowly.

name: Machine Hip Flexor (Cybex)
description: A hip isolation exercise that targets the hip flexors using a Cybex machine for improved leg lift power.
instructions: 1. Adjust the pad above your thigh and stand with one leg behind, 2. Drive the working leg forward to engage the hip flexor, 3. Hold briefly at the top, 4. Return with control and repeat.

name: Machine Glute (Cybex)
description: A glute isolation exercise using a Cybex machine to strengthen the gluteus maximus for posterior chain power.
instructions: 1. Place one foot on the platform and the other secured behind you, 2. Push the rear leg back and up in a controlled arc, 3. Squeeze your glute at the top, 4. Return to the start and switch legs.

name: Iso-Lateral Chest Press (Hammer Strength)
description: A unilateral pressing exercise that targets the chest using a Hammer Strength machine for balanced upper body strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the machine and position yourself securely, 2. Initiate the movement with control using the target muscle group, 3. Focus on a full range of motion while maintaining form, 4. Squeeze at the peak contraction, 5. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

name: Iso-Lateral Row (Hammer Strength)
description: A pulling back exercise that targets the lats using an iso-lateral Hammer Strength machine for balanced back development.
instructions: 1. Adjust the machine and position yourself securely, 2. Initiate the movement with control using the target muscle group, 3. Focus on a full range of motion while maintaining form, 4. Squeeze at the peak contraction, 5. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

name: Iso-Lateral Shoulder Press (Hammer Strength)
description: A unilateral overhead pressing exercise that targets the deltoids using Hammer Strength equipment for shoulder strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the machine and position yourself securely, 2. Initiate the movement with control using the target muscle group, 3. Focus on a full range of motion while maintaining form, 4. Squeeze at the peak contraction, 5. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

name: Iso-Lateral Lat Pulldown (Hammer Strength)
description: A vertical pulling exercise that targets the lats using a Hammer Strength lat pulldown machine for back width.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat and handles to align with your shoulders, 2. Grip the handles firmly and pull down with your lats, 3. Keep your chest up and avoid leaning back excessively, 4. Pause briefly at the bottom, 5. Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Iso-Lateral Low Row (Hammer Strength)
description: A horizontal pulling exercise that targets the mid-back using Hammer Strength equipment for posterior strength.
instructions: 1. Sit with feet planted and chest against the pad, 2. Grip the handles and initiate the pull with your back, 3. Keep elbows close and retract your scapulae fully, 4. Squeeze at the top, 5. Control the return and repeat.

name: Machine V-Squat (Hammer Strength)
description: A compound squat variation targeting the quads and glutes using a Hammer Strength machine for leg strength.
instructions: 1. Position your shoulders under the pads and feet on the platform, 2. Unrack the weight and lower into a deep squat, 3. Keep your knees tracking your toes and chest upright, 4. Drive through your heels to stand tall, 5. Repeat with controlled tempo.

name: Machine Leg Press (Hammer Strength)
description: A lower body pressing exercise that targets the quads using a Hammer Strength machine for leg hypertrophy.
instructions: 1. Sit back fully with feet shoulder-width on the platform, 2. Lower the sled by bending your knees, 3. Keep your back flat and knees aligned, 4. Push through your heels to return, 5. Avoid locking out your knees at the top.

name: Plate Loaded Leg Press (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Leg Press Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Leg Press
description: A powerful leg exercise that targets the quads and glutes using a plate-loaded Hammer Strength leg press for strength gains.
instructions: 1. Set up with feet shoulder-width on the sled, 2. Lower the platform slowly to a 90Â° knee bend, 3. Keep your back pressed against the pad, 4. Drive through your heels to press the sled, 5. Repeat with control.

name: Machine Seated Leg Curl (Hammer Strength)
description: A hamstring curl exercise that isolates the back of the thighs using Hammer Strength equipment for leg balance.
instructions: 1. Adjust the roller and back pad for comfort, 2. Hook your ankles and grip the handles, 3. Curl your legs down using hamstrings, 4. Hold briefly at full contraction, 5. Return slowly and repeat.

name: Machine Leg Extension (Hammer Strength)
description: An isolation movement for the quads using a Hammer Strength machine to enhance knee extension strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the pad to rest above your ankles, 2. Grip the handles and sit tall, 3. Extend your knees fully using your quads, 4. Pause briefly at the top, 5. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Machine Seated Calf Raise (Hammer Strength)
description: A calf exercise that targets the soleus using a seated Hammer Strength machine for ankle stability.
instructions: 1. Sit with thighs secured under the pad and toes on the platform, 2. Raise the weight by pressing through your toes, 3. Pause at full contraction, 4. Lower your heels below the platform edge, 5. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Standing Calf Raise (Hammer Strength)
description: A standing calf exercise that targets the gastrocnemius using Hammer Strength equipment for explosive calf strength.
instructions: 1. Position shoulders under pads and balls of feet on the platform, 2. Push through your toes to lift your heels, 3. Pause at the top for a squeeze, 4. Lower heels below the step, 5. Repeat with control.

name: Iso-Lateral Bench Press (Hammer Strength)
description: A chest press exercise that emphasizes even muscle activation using Hammer Strength iso-lateral equipment for pec development.
instructions: 1. Sit with back against the pad and grip the handles, 2. Press the handles forward and upward, 3. Extend arms without locking elbows, 4. Pause and squeeze your chest, 5. Return slowly.

name: Iso-Lateral Lat Pulldown (Hammer Strength & Reverse Grip)
alias_1: ISO Reverse Grip Lat Pulldown Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Reverse Grip Lat Pulldown
description: A unilateral lat pulldown targeting the back with reverse grip options for varied lat stimulation using Hammer Strength equipment.
instructions: 1. Sit with knees under the pad and grip handles underhand, 2. Pull the handles down using your lats, 3. Keep chest up and elbows down and back, 4. Squeeze at the bottom, 5. Control the return.

name: Iso-Lateral High Row (Hammer Strength)
description: A high pull exercise targeting the upper back and lats using Hammer Strength equipment for back size and strength.
instructions: 1. Set seat height and grip the handles overhead, 2. Pull the handles down and toward your sides, 3. Retract your shoulder blades at the bottom, 4. Pause and squeeze, 5. Slowly return.

name: Iso-Lateral Shrug (Hammer Strength)
description: A shrugging exercise that targets the trapezius using Hammer Strength iso-lateral handles for upper trap development.
instructions: 1. Stand or sit upright and grip the handles, 2. Shrug your shoulders up without bending your elbows, 3. Hold briefly at the top, 4. Lower under control, 5. Repeat.

name: Plate Loaded Bicep Curl (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Bicep Curl Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Bicep Curl
description: A biceps isolation movement using plate-loaded Hammer Strength equipment for arm hypertrophy.
instructions: 1. Sit with arms positioned under the pad and grip the handles, 2. Curl the handles toward your shoulders, 3. Keep your elbows fixed in place, 4. Pause at the top for a squeeze, 5. Lower slowly.

name: Machine Dip (Hammer Strength)
description: A triceps-dominant pushing exercise using Hammer Strength equipment for arm and chest development.
instructions: 1. Position yourself upright and grip the handles, 2. Lower your body by bending elbows, 3. Keep chest up and elbows close, 4. Push up through your triceps, 5. Repeat.

name: Plate-Loaded Seated Dip (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Seated Dip Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Seated Dip
description: A pressing movement for triceps and lower chest using a seated plate-loaded Hammer Strength dip machine for upper body strength.
instructions: 1. Sit with arms extended and hands gripping the handles, 2. Lower the weight by bending your elbows, 3. Keep torso upright and avoid swinging, 4. Push back to start, 5. Repeat.

name: Assisted Pull Up (Hammer Strength)
description: A bodyweight pulling exercise that targets the lats using Hammer Strength assistance for strength progression.
instructions: 1. Set the weight for assistance and grip the handles, 2. Step on the platform or knee pad, 3. Pull your chest to the bar while engaging lats, 4. Pause at the top, 5. Lower slowly.

name: Assisted Dip (Hammer Strength)
description: A pushing exercise that targets the triceps and chest with Hammer Strength support for controlled strength gains.
instructions: 1. Set assistance weight and grip the handles, 2. Lower your body by bending elbows, 3. Keep torso vertical, 4. Press back up through triceps, 5. Repeat with control.

name: Plate Loaded Jammer (Hammer Strength)
description: An explosive full-body pressing movement using plate-loaded Hammer Strength equipment for power and athleticism.
instructions: 1. Stand in an athletic stance and grip the handles, 2. Drive the handles forward and upward explosively, 3. Engage chest, shoulders, and arms, 4. Return to start with control, 5. Repeat.

name: Plate Loaded Ground Base Jammer (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Ground Base Jammer Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Ground Base Jammer
description: A standing explosive press that targets the chest and shoulders using Hammer Strength ground base equipment for dynamic movement.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet staggered and grip the handles, 2. Drive the arms forward while bracing your core, 3. Extend fully through the upper body, 4. Return under control, 5. Alternate if needed.

name: Plate Loaded Hack Squat (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Hack Squat Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Hack Squat
description: A quad-dominant squat variation using a plate-loaded Hammer Strength hack squat machine for lower body strength.
instructions: 1. Position shoulders under pads and feet forward on platform, 2. Lower yourself by bending hips and knees, 3. Keep back flat and core engaged, 4. Push through heels to stand, 5. Repeat.

name: Plate Loaded Linear Hack Squat (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Linear Hack Squat Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Linear Hack Squat
description: A linear guided squat that targets the quads and glutes using Hammer Strength equipment for leg hypertrophy.
instructions: 1. Step into the sled and place feet shoulder-width, 2. Lower the weight in a controlled squat, 3. Maintain upright posture, 4. Drive upward through heels, 5. Repeat.

name: Plate Loaded Pendulum Squat (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Pendulum Squat Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Pendulum Squat
description: A compound leg exercise targeting the quads and glutes using a pendulum squat machine for deep leg engagement.
instructions: 1. Set up with shoulders under pads and feet on platform, 2. Lower into a deep squat as the arc moves, 3. Keep knees aligned and core tight, 4. Push up powerfully, 5. Repeat.

name: Plate Loaded Belt Squat (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded Belt Squat Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded Belt Squat
description: A hip-dominant squat exercise that targets the quads and glutes using a belt-loaded Hammer Strength machine for spinal unloading.
instructions: 1. Attach the belt securely and stand on platform, 2. Squat down keeping chest up, 3. Push through heels to stand tall, 4. Avoid knee cave or hip shift, 5. Repeat.

name: Plate Loaded Deadlift (Hammer Strength)
description: A posterior chain exercise targeting the glutes and hamstrings using a plate-loaded deadlift machine for lower body power.
instructions: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and grip handles, 2. Keep chest up and back flat, 3. Drive through the floor to stand tall, 4. Squeeze glutes at the top, 5. Lower with control.

name: Plate Loaded T-Bar Row (Hammer Strength)
alias_1: Plate Loaded T-Bar Row Hammer Strength
alias_2: Hammer Strength Plate Loaded T-Bar Row
description: A rowing exercise that targets the mid-back using a plate-loaded T-bar for back thickness and strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with chest against pad and grip handles, 2. Pull the handles toward your torso, 3. Squeeze your shoulder blades at the top, 4. Lower slowly, 5. Repeat for reps.

name: Machine Chest Press (Technogym)
description: Horizontal pushing exercise that targets the pectorals, anterior deltoids, and triceps using a seated machine position for building upper body pressing strength and chest muscle development.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles align with mid-chest level, 2. Sit with your back flat against the pad and grip the handles with palms facing forward, 3. Press the handles forward until your arms are nearly straight without locking your elbows, 4. Slowly return to the starting position under control, 5. Keep your feet flat and core braced throughout the movement.

name: Machine Incline Chest Press (Technogym)
description: Inclined pushing exercise that targets the upper pectorals and anterior deltoids using an angled machine position for developing the upper portion of the chest.
instructions: 1. Set the seat height so the handles are at upper chest level when seated, 2. Sit back firmly with feet flat and grip the handles with elbows bent, 3. Press the handles upward and forward until your arms are extended, 4. Pause briefly, then return slowly to the start position, 5. Keep your shoulder blades retracted and avoid arching your back.

name: Machine Shoulder Press (Technogym)
description: Vertical pushing exercise that targets the deltoids and triceps using a seated machine position for building shoulder strength and stability.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles are at shoulder height, 2. Sit upright with your back against the pad and grip the handles, 3. Press the handles upward until your arms are fully extended without locking your elbows, 4. Lower the handles slowly and under control, 5. Keep your core tight and avoid shrugging your shoulders.

name: Machine Lat Pulldwon (Technogym)
description: Vertical pulling exercise that targets the latissimus dorsi, rhomboids, and biceps using a seated machine with overhead cable for developing back width and pulling strength.
instructions: 1. Sit down and adjust the thigh pad to secure your legs, 2. Grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip, 3. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your chest lifted, 4. Pause and squeeze your back, then slowly return the bar to the top, 5. Avoid swinging or leaning excessively.

name: Machine Low Row (Technogym)
description: Horizontal pulling exercise that targets the middle trapezius, rhomboids, and rear deltoids using a seated machine position for building back thickness and posture muscles.
instructions: 1. Sit with your chest against the pad and grip the handles with a neutral grip, 2. Pull the handles toward your torso while keeping elbows close to your sides, 3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end range, 4. Slowly extend your arms to return to the start, 5. Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rounding your back.

name: Plate Loaded Leg Press (Technogym)
description: Compound pushing exercise that targets the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings using a plate-loaded machine at an angle for developing lower body strength and power.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back and head against the pad and place your feet shoulder-width on the platform, 2. Unlock the sled and slowly lower it by bending your knees to about 90 degrees, 3. Press the platform upward by driving through your heels, 4. Extend your legs without locking your knees at the top, 5. Keep your hips and lower back in contact with the pad throughout.

name: Machine Leg Press (Technogym)
description: Compound pushing exercise that targets the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings using a selectorized machine for building leg strength with controlled resistance.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back against the pad and place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform, 2. Release the safety handles and lower the platform by bending your knees under control, 3. Stop once your knees form a 90-degree angle without lifting your hips, 4. Press the platform upward by driving through your heels, 5. Avoid locking your knees and keep your back flat throughout.

name: Machine Leg Extension (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the quadriceps using a seated machine position for developing knee extension strength and quad definition.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat and pad so it sits just above your ankles when seated, 2. Sit back with your knees aligned with the machineâ€™s pivot point, 3. Extend your legs to lift the weight while keeping your toes pointed slightly up, 4. Pause briefly at the top, then lower the weight slowly, 5. Keep your back against the pad and avoid swinging.

name: Machine Seated Leg Curl (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the hamstrings using a seated machine position for developing knee flexion strength and hamstring mass.
instructions: 1. Adjust the backrest and leg pads so the lower pad sits just above your heels, 2. Sit upright and secure your thighs under the top pad, 3. Curl your legs downward by contracting your hamstrings, 4. Pause briefly at the bottom, then return to the starting position with control, 5. Keep your torso still and avoid lifting off the seat.

name: Machine Hip Abduction (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the gluteus medius and tensor fasciae latae using a seated machine for strengthening hip stability and outer thigh muscles.
instructions: 1. Sit down and adjust the thigh pads to rest against the outside of your knees, 2. Keep your feet flat and grip the handles for support, 3. Push your legs outward against the pads until comfortably wide, 4. Pause briefly at full abduction, then return slowly to start, 5. Keep your core engaged and avoid leaning forward.

name: Machine Hip Adduction (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the adductor muscles using a seated machine for strengthening inner thigh muscles and hip stability.
instructions: 1. Sit and position the thigh pads against your inner knees with legs spread apart, 2. Hold the handles and keep your back against the pad, 3. Press your thighs together to bring the pads inward, 4. Squeeze at the top and return slowly to the start, 5. Avoid jerking or bouncing the weight.

name: Plate Loaded Seated Calf Raises (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the soleus muscle using a seated plate-loaded position for developing lower calf strength and size.
instructions: 1. Sit on the machine and place the balls of your feet on the foot platform, 2. Position your thighs under the pads and release the safety stop, 3. Lower your heels fully to stretch your calves, 4. Press through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible, 5. Pause at the top, then return slowly to the stretch position.

name: Plate Loaded Standing Calf Raises (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the gastrocnemius muscle using a standing plate-loaded position for building calf height and power.
instructions: 1. Stand on the platform with the balls of your feet on the edge and shoulders under the pads, 2. Lift your heels to unrack the weight, 3. Lower your heels slowly to achieve a deep calf stretch, 4. Press through your toes to raise your heels as high as possible, 5. Keep your knees straight and core tight throughout.

name: Machine Rotary Torso (Technogym)
description: Rotational exercise that targets the obliques and core muscles using a seated machine for developing rotational strength and trunk stability.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat height so your torso aligns with the machineâ€™s axis of rotation, 2. Sit upright and grip the handles with your chest against the pad, 3. Rotate your torso against resistance to one side while keeping hips stable, 4. Pause at the end range and return slowly to the center, 5. Repeat in the opposite direction while maintaining core engagement.

name: Machine Abdominal Crunch (Technogym)
description: Flexion exercise that targets the rectus abdominis using a seated machine for building core strength and abdominal definition.
instructions: 1. Sit with the back pad aligned to your spine and feet flat on the platform, 2. Grip the handles and brace your core, 3. Crunch forward by contracting your abs and pulling your ribs toward your hips, 4. Pause briefly at the bottom, then return to the starting position slowly, 5. Avoid using momentum or pulling with your arms.

name: Machine Back Extension (Technogym)
description: Extension exercise that targets the erector spinae and glutes using a prone machine position for strengthening the posterior chain and improving posture.
instructions: 1. Adjust the pad so it supports your upper back just below the shoulder blades, 2. Sit with your feet flat and arms crossed or holding the handles, 3. Extend your torso backward while keeping your core braced, 4. Pause at the top and avoid overextending, 5. Return slowly to the neutral starting position.

name: Machine Pectural Fly (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the pectorals using a seated machine with arc motion for developing chest width and muscle separation.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so that your elbows are level with your chest when holding the handles, 2. Sit back with your arms slightly bent and grip the handles with palms facing forward, 3. Bring the handles together in front of your chest in a hugging motion, 4. Squeeze your chest at the peak contraction, then return slowly, 5. Keep your shoulders down and avoid locking out your elbows.

name: Machine Reverse Fly (Technogym)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the rear deltoids and rhomboids using a seated machine for improving posture and rear shoulder strength.
instructions: 1. Set the seat height so the handles are level with your shoulders when seated, 2. Sit facing the pad and grasp the handles with a slight bend in your elbows, 3. Pull the handles outward and back in a wide arc, squeezing your shoulder blades, 4. Pause at full contraction, then return with control, 5. Keep your chest against the pad and avoid using momentum.

name: Machine Vertical Traction (Technogym)
description: Vertical pulling exercise that targets the latissimus dorsi and biceps using a standing machine position for developing back strength and grip.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles are slightly above shoulder height when seated, 2. Sit upright and grasp the handles with a neutral grip, 3. Pull the handles down toward your sides while squeezing your lats, 4. Pause at the bottom and control the return to the top, 5. Avoid leaning back or shrugging during the movement.

name: Machine Hack Squat (Technogym)
description: Compound pushing exercise that targets the quadriceps and glutes using an angled machine position for building leg strength with back support.
instructions: 1. Stand on the platform with your back and shoulders against the pads, 2. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and release the safety locks, 3. Lower the sled by bending your knees and hips until thighs are at least parallel to the platform, 4. Drive through your heels to press the sled back up, 5. Keep your back flat and avoid locking your knees.

name: Plate Loaded Pure Deadlift (Technogym)
description: Compound pulling exercise that targets the posterior chain including hamstrings, glutes, and erector spinae using a plate-loaded machine for developing total body strength.
instructions: 1. Stand with your shins close to the bar and feet hip-width apart, 2. Bend at the hips and knees to grip the handles with a neutral spine, 3. Drive through your heels and extend your hips to lift the weight, 4. Squeeze your glutes at the top, then lower with control, 5. Keep your core braced and avoid rounding your back.

name: Machine Chest Press (Nautilus)
description: Horizontal pushing exercise that targets the pectorals, anterior deltoids, and triceps using a seated machine position for building upper body pressing strength and chest development.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles align with mid-chest, 2. Sit upright with your back flat and grip the handles with palms forward, 3. Press the handles forward until your arms are extended but not locked, 4. Slowly return to the starting position with control, 5. Keep your core braced and feet flat on the ground.

name: Plate Loaded Chest Press (Nautilus)
description: Horizontal pushing exercise that targets the pectorals and triceps using a plate-loaded machine for developing chest strength with variable resistance.
instructions: 1. Sit down with your back against the pad and grasp the handles with a firm grip, 2. Press the handles forward in a controlled motion until arms are nearly straight, 3. Pause at full extension and avoid locking the elbows, 4. Lower the handles back with control, 5. Maintain back contact and keep your shoulders stable.

name: Machine Incline Chest Press (Nautilus)
description: Inclined pushing exercise that targets the upper pectorals and anterior deltoids using an angled machine position for upper chest development.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles align with your upper chest, 2. Sit back and grip the handles with elbows slightly below shoulder height, 3. Press upward and slightly forward until your arms extend, 4. Return slowly to the starting position, 5. Avoid shrugging and keep your chest up.

name: Plate Loaded Incline Chest Press (Nautilus)
description: Inclined pushing exercise that targets the upper pectorals using a plate-loaded angled position for building upper chest mass and strength.
instructions: 1. Sit back with the seat set to align handles with upper chest, 2. Grip the handles firmly with palms facing forward, 3. Press the handles upward and forward without locking out your elbows, 4. Control the descent to the starting point, 5. Keep your shoulder blades back and down.

name: Leverage Shoulder Press (Nautilus)
description: Vertical pushing exercise that targets the deltoids using a leverage-based machine for developing shoulder strength with natural movement patterns.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so the handles are at shoulder height, 2. Sit upright and grip the handles with palms forward, 3. Press the handles straight up until your arms are nearly straight, 4. Slowly lower the handles while keeping tension, 5. Keep your core tight and avoid leaning back.

name: Machine Shoulder Press (Nautilus)
description: Vertical pushing exercise that targets the deltoids and triceps using a seated machine position for building shoulder strength and stability.
instructions: 1. Sit down with your back against the pad and adjust the seat so handles are at shoulder height, 2. Grip the handles with an overhand grip, 3. Press upward without locking your elbows, 4. Pause at the top, then lower slowly, 5. Keep a steady tempo and avoid arching your lower back.

name: Machine Lateral Raise (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the medial deltoids using a seated machine for developing shoulder width and lateral deltoid strength.
instructions: 1. Sit with the pads against your upper arms and adjust the seat for shoulder alignment, 2. Grip the handles or the side pads as directed, 3. Raise your arms outward to shoulder level by leading with your elbows, 4. Pause at the top, then return under control, 5. Keep your back still and avoid using momentum.

name: Machine Pullover (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the latissimus dorsi and serratus anterior using a seated machine for developing lat width and rib cage expansion.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat and arms so your elbows are slightly bent when gripping the handles overhead, 2. Sit back and grasp the handles with a neutral grip, 3. Pull the handles down in an arc toward your torso while squeezing your lats, 4. Pause, then return the arms overhead slowly, 5. Keep your head and spine neutral throughout.

name: Machine Lat Pulldown (Nautilus)
description: Vertical pulling exercise that targets the latissimus dorsi and biceps using a seated machine for building back width and pulling strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the thigh pad to secure your legs and grip the handles with a wide overhand grip, 2. Pull the handles down toward your upper chest while leaning back slightly, 3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom, 4. Return the handles overhead with control, 5. Keep your elbows in line with the movement and avoid jerking.

name: Leverage Low Row (Nautilus)
description: Horizontal pulling exercise that targets the middle trapezius and rhomboids using a leverage-based machine for developing back thickness with natural movement.
instructions: 1. Sit facing the machine with feet braced and chest supported, 2. Grip the handles with a neutral or overhand grip, 3. Pull the handles toward your lower ribs while keeping your elbows close to your sides, 4. Squeeze your back, then return slowly, 5. Avoid rounding your back and keep your torso stable.

name: Machine Mid Row (Nautilus)
description: Horizontal pulling exercise that targets the middle trapezius, rhomboids, and rear deltoids using a seated machine for building back thickness and posture.
instructions: 1. Sit upright with your chest against the pad and feet flat, 2. Grip the handles with a neutral grip and elbows slightly bent, 3. Pull the handles toward your torso by squeezing your shoulder blades together, 4. Pause, then extend your arms slowly back to start, 5. Keep your back flat and avoid leaning forward.

name: Machine Leg Press (Nautilus)
description: Compound pushing exercise that targets the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings using a selectorized machine for controlled leg strength development.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back and head against the pad and place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform, 2. Release the safety and lower the sled by bending your knees under control, 3. Lower until your knees form roughly a 90-degree angle, 4. Press through your heels to extend legs without locking knees, 5. Keep your lower back flat and avoid lifting your hips.

name: Plate Loaded Leg Press (Nautilus)
description: Compound pushing exercise that targets the quadriceps and glutes using a plate-loaded machine for building lower body power and strength.
instructions: 1. Sit back firmly with feet shoulder-width on the platform, 2. Unlock the sled and lower the platform slowly by bending knees, 3. Stop at a 90-degree knee angle without hip lift, 4. Drive through heels to extend knees, 5. Maintain a neutral spine throughout.

name: Machine Leg Extension (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the quadriceps using a seated machine position for developing knee extension strength and quad definition.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat and ankle pad so your knees align with the pivot point, 2. Sit back with your back flat and feet under the pad, 3. Extend your legs fully while keeping toes pointed up, 4. Pause, then lower slowly, 5. Avoid locking your knees or swinging.

name: Machine Seated Leg Curl (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the hamstrings using a seated machine position for building hamstring strength and mass.
instructions: 1. Adjust the pad behind your ankles and the backrest for comfort, 2. Sit upright and secure your thighs under the top pad, 3. Curl your legs down by contracting your hamstrings, 4. Pause, then return to the start under control, 5. Keep your torso steady and avoid lifting.

name: Machine Prone Leg Curl (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the hamstrings using a prone machine position for developing hamstring strength with full range of motion.
instructions: 1. Lie face down on the machine with your knees aligned under the lever pad, 2. Grip the handles or machine for stability, 3. Curl your legs upward by contracting your hamstrings, 4. Pause, then lower with control, 5. Keep your hips pressed down and avoid swinging.

name: Plate Loaded Seated Calf Raise (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the soleus muscle using a seated plate-loaded position for building lower calf strength and size.
instructions: 1. Sit and place the balls of your feet on the platform, 2. Position your thighs under the pads and unlock the safety, 3. Lower your heels to stretch calves fully, 4. Press up through the balls of your feet as high as possible, 5. Pause at the top, then lower slowly.

name: Machine Seated Calf Raise (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the soleus muscle using a seated machine for developing lower calf strength with controlled resistance.
instructions: 1. Sit with your feet on the platform and pads on your thighs, 2. Lower your heels fully to stretch calves, 3. Press through the balls of your feet to lift your heels, 4. Hold the contraction, then lower back slowly, 5. Maintain controlled movement throughout.

name: Machine Hip Abduction (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the gluteus medius using a seated machine for strengthening hip stability and outer glute muscles.
instructions: 1. Sit with pads against the outside of your knees and feet flat, 2. Hold the handles for support, 3. Push your legs outward against the pads until stretched, 4. Pause, then slowly return to start, 5. Keep your back straight and core engaged.

name: Machine Hip Adduction (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the adductor muscles using a seated machine for building inner thigh strength and hip stability.
instructions: 1. Sit with pads against the inside of your knees and feet flat, 2. Hold handles for stability, 3. Squeeze your legs inward to bring the pads together, 4. Pause and return slowly, 5. Avoid using momentum and keep your torso upright.

name: Machine Preacher Curl (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the biceps using a seated machine with arm support for developing bicep peak and strength.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so your upper arms rest flat on the preacher pad, 2. Grip the handles or bar with an underhand grip, 3. Curl the weight up by contracting your biceps without lifting your elbows, 4. Pause at the top, then lower slowly until arms are fully extended, 5. Keep your back straight and avoid swinging.

name: Machine Bicep Curl (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the biceps using a seated machine position for building arm strength and muscle definition.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back flat and grip the handles with palms up, 2. Keep your elbows fixed by your sides, 3. Curl the handles toward your shoulders, 4. Pause, then lower the weight with control, 5. Avoid using momentum or lifting your shoulders.

name: Machine Tricep Extension (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the triceps using a seated machine position for developing arm extension strength and tricep mass.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat and grip the handles overhead with elbows bent, 2. Keep your upper arms stationary by your ears, 3. Extend your elbows to push the handles downward, 4. Pause, then return slowly, 5. Maintain a tight core and avoid flaring your elbows.

name: Machine Seated Dip (Nautilus)
description: Compound pushing exercise that targets the triceps, chest, and anterior deltoids using a seated machine for building upper body pressing strength.
instructions: 1. Sit with your back straight and grip the handles at your sides, 2. Keep your elbows close to your body, 3. Push down to extend your elbows and contract your triceps, 4. Pause, then slowly return to the start, 5. Avoid shrugging your shoulders or locking your elbows.

name: Machine Pec Fly (Nautilus)
description: Isolation exercise that targets the pectorals using a seated machine with arc motion for developing chest width and definition.
instructions: 1. Adjust the seat so your elbows are at chest level, 2. Sit back and grip the handles with elbows slightly bent, 3.
